scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At Maria and Charlie's. Enjoyed excursion to mountains (full description of trip to "Ceasar's Head") and a trip to Warm Springs and Paint Rock. Had a fall and suffered from hot baths. Social events. Full account of Christmas. (A very descriptive letter).

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Home news. Skating in square. Father gave dinner for judges - very fine affair. About contracts for houses.

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Journey to Washington and illness. Auntie left. Drives. Katy, Connie and Eddie. Katy's poetry. Social activities, friends and family news. Charlie Ross' kidnapping. 29 August 1874- Auntie and Uncle Charlie returned home from Mount Desert and left again for Atlantic City where I joined them. About getting watches in Geneva.

did.unittitle: Emily to Horace

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Esther ill (dreadful cold). Minna ill too. Man came up to me and stated I should have Roy painted (most beautiful face) by Richter in Berlin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Business and home news. More about contracts for houses.

scopecontent.p: About children, other rooms, and planning dinner for instructors.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for cigar case. On German servants. Mrs. Linkler killed when thrown out of carriage. Many deaths due to pneumonia. Engagement of Douglas Williams and Elizabeth Welsh. Very cold winter.

did.unittitle: Garnet C. Neagle to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Is sending portrait painted by father of Professor R. Hare and will sell for $50. Enclosing a note to Mrs. Robert Hare inquiring what to do with original portrait of Professor Robert Hare from John Neagle. Also a note from Clark Hare, returning pisture because so unlike his father.

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reference to housing when you return. Feels you should return to 21st St. and not live with them. Gives reasons. Problems of the houses to be built by Father for you and ourselves.

scopecontent.p: About visiting the Townes.

scopecontent.p: Sightseeing, theatre and opera. Will not get your hat. Going to race on Sunday (don't beathe a word of it in Leipzig or at home).

scopecontent.p: About giving up rooms because two children died in that house of Diptheria.

did.unittitle: Horace to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to horse races with Arthur Biddle. Activities in Paeris. Going to "look up" Uncle Richard's brother Alfred.

did.unittitle: Horace to Emily

scopecontent.p: Visited Notre Dame. Minot's visited me. Going to dinner with Arthur Biddle.

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Everything settled about house except signing contract. Family and friends. Also one of Feb. 15 - Eyeglasses cords must have been lost or stolen. Business about house plans, cost, etc.

did.unittitle: Emily to Mr. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Not moving into rooms previously engaged because there had been Diptheria in the house. Moved downstairs but still looking for rooms.

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Houses to be begun in May. Maria Fisher's baby ill. Social events - "Calico Costume Party". Grandfather inquires about bill you were to draw upon him.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare (Mother)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In new lodgings, description of it and neighbors and German language.

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on photos. Inquiries on Mendelssohn and Frau Consul Krauth. About renting your house on 21st St. House on 22nd St. should be ready by January.

did.unittitle: Mamma Hare to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Praising her as a wife and mother. Getting ready for summer at Waring and anxious for you to come. W. Montgomery to marry, but her family not helping at all and thinks it "most unsatisfactory".

did.unittitle: Mother to Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About Eddie's affair. Request you bring her anything "Freytag" has written, other German books and children's books. See if you can locate or hear anything about friend's husband. Still indignant about Will Montgomery's wedding - doesn't know what they're going to do.

did.unittitle: N.S. Jenkins to Emily

scopecontent.p: Will see Mrs. Hare after he returns. Telegram enclosed on which he comments on spelling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written sketch of incident in Baltimore. 1834 - panic over removal of government deposits from Bank of United States by President Jackson. Mr. Webster and Mr. Binney made speeches upon stopping in Baltimore in which Mr. Binney said "when all constitutional measures fail, I repeat, fellow citizens - when all constitutional measures fail, I need not tell you what other remedy is in the hands of the people".

Horace to Mrs. Hare (Mother)

scopecontent.p: Going to North Carolina. News of town, family and friends.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare (Mother)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Intense heat. Spent week with Charlie and now have rented log house 9 miles from Asheville which with team of mules and wagon is 2 hours each way. Tells how he's getting food for family. Have a good cook.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare (Mother)

scopecontent.p: 4th of July celebrations. Leaving for North Carolina. Judge Lynd died of lockjaw.

scopecontent.p: Trip to Black Mountain. Minnie Hare had daughter. Uncle Robert, wife and Miss Sanieska came to dinner on way to Caeser's Head. Health and chigger, tick and flea bites. Request you get 4 pairs gauze drawers and under shirts.

did.unittitle: Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.p: Whole family benefited health-wise from summer. Farming in North Carolina.

scopecontent.p: General news of family.

scopecontent.p: Emily ill. To meet you in Savannah.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Emily very weak. Plans for going home in car to be brought down by Father (train). Will have chickens killed when car comes.

scopecontent.p: Car a godsend with both of them ill. Try to arrange for awnings, mosquito net and a bed for Emily.

scopecontent.p: Doing well. (telegram)

scopecontent.p: Description of voyage and trip across Isthmus in baggage car. Haven't decided whether to spend winter at sea or Sandwich Islands.

scopecontent.p: About plans for Australian journey. Explanations of your objevtions to our own "schooner". Moving to Oakland.

scopecontent.p: Pros and cons on the subject of owning a "schooner".

scopecontent.p: Friendly with a Judge McCrea. Horace's health and Esther's Christmas.

scopecontent.p: On board "City of Sidney" waiting to leave.

scopecontent.p: Had rough passage. Should arrive in Honolulu tomorrow.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.p: Rough passage but able to enjoy it. News of wreck of vessel with 600 Chinaman on it.

did.unittitle: Mother to Dr. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Children well. Baby has no more teeth but some coming and he stands firmly. Willing fine. He was sledding. Have filled traps in house with glycerine. Best wishes on health and voyage.

did.unittitle: Alvine Schumacher to Horace Binney Hare
Emily to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.p: Monotonous voyage. Horace doing well. Weather. February 27 - in Sydney.

did.unittitle: Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.p: Expenses. General traveling news on city, weather, etc.

scopecontent.p: Horace doing well. Suggests Horace could spend summer in country near Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.p: Received telegram but not sure who's coming to see him off. Sore throat but otherwise better. Wants you and Father to see yacht.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delightful cruise but split wood at mast head. Waiting for you. Either bring or send plans of tanks.

scopecontent.p: Pleased with yacht. News of family, friends and the people around here.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mother

scopecontent.p: Lacking strength. Leaving tomorrow for Gibralter.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Waiting for "wind" to start on voyage. New cook and Ingham.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On leaving alone for health on yacht to Gibralter. Hopes to see you December in St. Thomas.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note - improving and all well. Sent Bonnesis ?, the cook, home.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent cook home. Hard winds. Am better but voice gone and not much strength.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cooking excellent since "cook" left. Clifton and the Steward doing the cooking. Hard winds, but "Resolute" behaving splendidly. Delayed for some carpentry work on boat.

did.unittitle: Thomas E. Ivers to J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (copy) Repairs needed on Yacht "Resolute".

did.unittitle: Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About repairs needed on boat and journey so far.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had pleasant trip from Gibralter. On way to Barbadoes. Still without voice. Request for recipes - boiled Indian pudding and Batter pudding (with practically no insides).

did.unittitle: Horace to Judge Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Drawing $500 for repairs to ship.

did.unittitle: Horace to Judge and Mrs. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In dry dock having repairs made. Principal officials have visited but have been considerate since I am an invalid.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Been in bed for week due to weather. In dry dock. The island grows pineapples for England.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Does not know when child was born. Voyage from Azores to Gibraltar. Sore throat gone, but otherwise no better.

did.unittitle: Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vessel stood gale well. Very gratified at news of your nomination by both parties. About supplies for yacht.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General news of his mental and physical condition and the voyage.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About cooking. Live turkeys on board. Turtles were caught. American Consul paid a visit.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delayed because of gale. Of food, parrot, plans of voyage after you join me in St. Thomas.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Still waiting for "wind". Bring periodicals and hams with you. Ingham has bought a lot of brass plates.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant voyage from Madiera. All "hands" satisfactory except Steward who stole oranges. About arrival in Barbadoes harbor. Misunderstanding about when Emily's coming. Can't get rid of Steward without paying him 3 months wages.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Christmas and New Year's wishes. Feeling stronger. Leaving here until time for Emily to come. Has to go into quarantine.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaving for healthier place until the 10th of January when you arrive. Must go into quarantine.

did.unittitle: Horace Binney Hare to Mrs. Charles Willing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Explaining mix-up on letters and Emily's coming. Weather, burning of sugar factories, Dr. Ingham as a companion and helpmate.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very "blue" Christmas day. Sailors drunk. Ask Father about plans for cruising after March when too hot and unhealthy in West Indies.

did.unittitle: List of expenses

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expenses for Yacht, July 1878 to Janaury 1879.

did.unittitle: Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Explaining worry of Emily, his stay at Azores for repairs, and cruising around West Indies waiting for Emily. Still without voice, but feels better. Asks advice about Spring months cruise and gives suggestions.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received telegram December 31 which said Emily will leave on the 16th for Havanna.

did.unittitle: Emily and Horace to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Due to intestinal attack (diarrhea), Horace's note short about expenses and contacting Hatch (seller of boat and responsible for expenses). One from Emily telling of Horace's condition and Willy Binney's attention to them in Havana.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Much about children. Willing and Baby. Visit to Havana. Missing you dreadfully since leaving yacht. Voyage to New York and visit to West Point. Everyone wild about opera "H.M.S. Pinafore" playing now. About friends and relations. Sorry to hear Horace no better.

did.unittitle: C. Sherbuer to H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent you a paper which I read at Geological Society. Inquiry as to family and health. Have been obliged to give up studies abroad and have been ill. About friends from Leipzig.

did.unittitle: Emily to J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace no better. From Curacao to Martinique.

did.unittitle: Emily to J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace very ill. Expect to head homeward and go to port probably in Savannah.

did.unittitle: Dr. William Pepper to J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received telegram of Horace's death from Ingham, St. Thomas. Offering service in any way.

scopecontent.p: Sympathy letter on loss of husband.

did.unittitle: Newspaper articles

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article on Prince Imperial (England) killed by Zulus. Faculty of University of Pennsylvania - 1877. Article on suit by lady's maid against Duchess for libel. Article on Judge Hare's comments on Constitution of 1787. One on Horace B. Hare's portrayal of Golightly in "Five Shillings". One on Earl of Beaconsfield and Mr. Gladstone.

did.unittitle: E. P. H. to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived O.K., but not feeling well so will probably not stay long.

did.unittitle: E. P. H. to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mr. Hare and I both want to come home tomorrow. Children enjoying themselves.

did.unittitle: F. Herversdorf ? to Mrs. Hare
E. P. H. to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Feeling better, but not well. About plastering in house to be done.

did.unittitle: C. H. to Mrs. Esther C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad you are coming. Wish you could bring Esther. Found spectacles. Baby's manners perfect.

scopecontent.p: Report of things at home.

did.unittitle: Alvine Hammann to Mrs. H.B. Hare
Peyton Ward to Mrs. H. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Terrible voyage from New York. Cut shins when ship lurched. Was so glad to visit you and hopes to again in Fall. "Lines" written in Panama about meeting again.

did.unittitle: Coleridge to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for copy of your address on English and American politics and comments on it and English politics.

scopecontent.p: Sympathy letter on death of Dr. Hare, and personal recollections of you on "Grenada".

scopecontent.p: In reference to Dr. Hare's will.

scopecontent.p: About Germany and Switzerland for education of children, and Italy where they are staying for his work. Commodore Uphure and his family. (A sort of valentine enclosed).

scopecontent.p: C.H. - About trip up and arrival which delighted children, Emily, Constance and Mrs. Beale. Emily - Not enjoying it here and wants to get home.

did.unittitle: Letter in German
J.I.C. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About Geneva ("the prettiest city in the world"). And about your plans for taking children abroad for winter - wants you to leave Willing with him. You and children only "green spot" in his desert. Comments on trip. (Sounds very homesick)

did.unittitle: Mother to Esther

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Elizabeth's health after her confinement. About family and friends, weddings, etc., and "putting up" peaches.

did.unittitle: Auntie to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad you enjoyed your visit to "Tockington". Uncle will not allow me to pay to send your Mother abroad with you, but will add something to Connie's allowance. Trying to explain intimations you made in regard to differences between her and your Mother.

scopecontent.p: About your leaving and just friendly conversation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speaking of "life" and the future.

scopecontent.p: Commenting on obedience.

scopecontent.p: Getting settled in Biarritz - lovely here.

scopecontent.p: Child's letter to grandfather.

scopecontent.p: Weather - storms and wind. Children learning French and Esther taking riding lessons.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.p: Sorry you had such a bad voyage. A shipwreck during storm. Taking riding lessons.

scopecontent.p: Just learned how ill you have been from rough voyage. Rainy weather and flooding rivers.

scopecontent.p: Engraving bill.

scopecontent.p: Rainy weather, tornado and homesick. Gratitude for your kind care in summer.

did.unittitle: Emily to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Best wishes for season with a bunch of wild flowers. Take care of your eyes.

scopecontent.p: Card.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to "hunt" with Aunt Connie. Studying Latin and Italian. Visited Bayonne, France. Thank you for money for "riding".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you note for Christmas present.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.p: Visited Anglet (convent) with Miss Welling. Taking music lessons.

did.unittitle: Emily to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Davis coming abroad, and Dr. Meigs death. Friendly with a man, General Woodhouse who knows relatives (Hares) in Norfolk County and Irish relatives of mine. And about the children.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mr. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been acting as mamma with Emily away to Paris. Heard Count di Harrow's music.

Ella to Madame Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for gift and sad at your leaving.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tells about their visiting Monte Carle, Monaco and concert. Asks about his horse and rabbits.

did.unittitle: Connie to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stopped here on way from Milan to Paris. Went fishing with Willing and Esther, but would have been better if "Grandpa" was there. Intended to sail for home the 28th of June, but now may remain for a while and wishes you would come over.

did.unittitle: Ella to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for photos of you, Willing and Esther. About her family, friends and Biarritz.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to visit Biarritz in summer.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very much about setting Kate's wedding date (very much against their making hasty and hurried plans). About your children at Harford. Your proposal of Katy married from your house a nice idea. Uncle C. and Aunty postponing idea of a house for me.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Play cricket, went to tower where Lord Guilford Dudly was imprisoned and to Hyde Park.

scopecontent.p: Request for copy of your book on Constitutional Law, for Sir Henry Maine. Sending you a copy of my "England's Case against Home Rule."

scopecontent.p: Coming home (please send transportation money). Tobogganing and spelling "bee".

scopecontent.p: Passed Sacred Studies examination. Coming home.

scopecontent.p: Brother's letter to sister - weather, missing you, etc.

scopecontent.p: Homesick. Starting a gymnasium class. Wants to lose some weight. Request for Bible, umbrella, stamps, shoebag and clothesbag.

scopecontent.p: Read about your presence at City Troop Ball in paper. Reading Shakespeare's "Julius Caesar".

scopecontent.p: Doesn't like gymnasium class. Was snowshoeing. Bought secondhand racquet for "Racquets".

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Homesick. Despises it there. German, music, tobogganing and dance.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received package and thanks you, boys and Esther. Went for a sleigh ride.

scopecontent.p: Music lessons. Enclosed account of terrible railroad accident. About books sent to Dr. Coyt from Aunty.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Took first German lesson. Would like 8 pretty valentines and 2 funny ones to send.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Commanded" to Rectory for evening - a most stupid affair.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very pleased with valentines. Tobogganing. Having trouble with having clothes washed.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Valentines received. Two riddles. Uncle Oliver coming to spend Washington's birthday. Weather.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Climate. Ask Grandmamma Beale to send lozenges with Uncle Oliver. Thinks "story" instead of "play" to be very stupid.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has bad cold. Uncle Oliver has not arrived. About "dude" there.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of excursion to Shaker Village in sleigh.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Band of Mercy started by Uncle Oliver. Two boys ran away from school. Death of one of boys at school. Would like to stop German.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to have photograph taken. Going to take dinner with Cunningham and his Mother. One of the runaway boys taken back into school.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scarf, pin, shirt stud and overcoat have been found. Would like oranges.

scopecontent.p: Went in open sleigh to dinner with Mrs. Stevens. Had photograph taken. Feels it would be better if you didn't come up right on Easter.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Homesick. No toboggening, so played "Racquets". Went on sleigh ride but unsafe so could not finish it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About engaging you a room. Aunt Susan's death. Believe have passed all examinations which were oral ones. Enclose list of "goodies" Mrs. Stevens brought to give you idea of what I would like. Humerous extracts from a book.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would like subscription to either the "Press" of "Times", and needs cricket shirt.

scopecontent.p: Needs money for Easter flowers for Chapel. Lecture on Holland. List of things wanted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would like to come home for Easter.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Account of how he spent Easter holidays. Weather - 100 degrees on Easter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Quoits is the game at present. Pleased with bird and flowers you sent. Wants four of Dina's pups. All the things to be done for you if you come up.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Weather. Clothes needed. Invited Grandmamma Beale to come up with you.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miss you and want you to come up. Weather. Cunyingham Stevens disappeared - thinks he has gone home. Needs Spring clothing and wants food. Hates school and doesn't want to go back another year.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Truxton Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Upset while boating.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Needs Spring clothes. Went canoeing. Cun got back yesterday (had gone home for wedding). Sprained finger playing ball.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thermometer 90 degrees - needs Spring clothes.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Too warm with winter underclothing, (wasting to a shadow). Miss Vanbribba. Rumor of scarlet fever in school.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Winter flannels too hot when 90 degrees in the shade, so please send clothes. Three fellows have Scarletina.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miss you - please come up. Still "melting" in winter clothes, so please send others, and also food.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mamma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cravats arrived. Holiday - tennis in morning, then Chapel, boat race, dinner, sports events and rest of afternoon with 2 lovely girls. Another evening with the girls, and other people he met. Coming home in 3 weeks. Where are we going this summer? Wants money to buy picture of boys at school.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Need money for traveling expenses home. Bishop Stevens ill and not expected to live. Boat races. Ideas on dating older girls.

Would like to have horse to ride. Very dull staying with Grandmama. Horace would like money for air gun. A verse - "The Parting" by C.W.H.

scopecontent.p: Coming home.

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About court sessions and if it suits you, take November sessions.

did.unittitle: Maimy to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: If you come abroad in fall, you must visit.

did.unittitle: Katharine to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Here to see plays.

did.unittitle: E.B.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Home news.

did.unittitle: H.B.H. and Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Activities and weather.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paid bills, went to N.Y. with Sam Chew, saw "Beau Brummell", then went to New Haven about rooms. Cass's friend, Mr. Cameron, visiting. Letter from Aunt Connie saying she and Grandma will stay abroad, and probably Grandpa too.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Redirested box from Howard and Co. Enclose bill from Geroud. Cass and Mr. Cameron (together so much in private). Home news.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ellen Harrison and Edith Wall visited and Ellen asked me to tea. Oliver and Aunt Katy arrived very late and I thought it was robbers. Cass and Mr. Cameron's flirtation very amusing.,

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Instructions on keeping house at home. Katharine Cheston pretty and admired by all.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Misses you here terribly. About things at your home. Kate and Oliver, E. & W., and "Reverendy" Cameron's visit, (was so teased about him). Plans for trip to Geneva.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (Private) Visitors, dinner at Dr. Chapman's and at the Rebo. Horace has been no where - flies kites all day. (Shocked to hear of Cass's proceedings.)

did.unittitle: E. to Mrs. Beale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mad rush - dinners, etc. Horace with me - independent in a boarding house across the way. Bay Hunt engaged to Mr. Slater. He has son and Enid engaged to him. Cass wants to join me abroad this winter, but I don't think it will work.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coming home, stopping at Portsmouth. Advising not to be extravagant keeping house and for Willing to study.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of visit to Venice - (a glorious place) - palaces, terrible storm, etc. and plans of further travels.

did.unittitle: Cass to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of place and journey there. Evening in town with "Reverendy". Went to toy factory with Mrs. Cunningham and daughters Eleanor's music and Katherine's sketches.

did.unittitle: Grandmama to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandfather sick - confined to bed. In the "High Alps". Mr. and Mrs. Livingston and Kitty visited.

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stay as long as you wish - Pennypacker and I will take care of the court sessions.

did.unittitle: Samuel W. Pennypacker to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rely on Fell and myself to do court work. Remain where you are until entirely restored.

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Do not think of resigning. We can do the work and esteem it a privilege to relieve you while you take an indefinite furlough.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry, cannot be with your party this winter, but maybe could join "M.C." and Constance in St. Petersburgh. Ordered your Herbert's book. Willing's teasing - "never was so teased in my life before."

did.unittitle: Joachim Beck Friis (?) to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sincere thanks for pleasant visit in your home.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Passed exams and enter college "free from conditions". Coming home tomorrow. Box arrived and unpacked.

did.unittitle: Thomas F. Davies to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for your picture. Write from Europe. Pray you go and come in safety.

did.unittitle: John L. Cadwalader to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will stay in town late enough to see you before you leave.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sad at parting.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expect to see you in Italy and hope you will study and enjoy the wonders that lie open to you. And a letter from Constance to Emily telling of friends and where they are in Europe.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for your journey to Florence. Saw Queen of Romania several times (too weak to walk so brought down in chair), and also saw King of Italy who came to visit the Queen. Also a note from sister (C) explaining Mr. Hare's plans and to say Emily Welling will join you at Paris to come down.

did.unittitle: Samuel Chew to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Does not think he can come to New York to see you before you go abroad, but will if he can.

did.unittitle: Maimy to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About rooms there for you. Not much going on there this winter - in mourning for Grand Duchess. Wants Aunt Mary Anna and Connie to come too.

did.unittitle: John T. Lewis & Brothers Co. to ________

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of monies due.

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Give up any thought of resigning, and stay abroad as long as it is of benefit to you. Court work being done.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mr. Nichols not chosen for parish at St. Peter's in Philadelphia, rooms are comfortable, and about a fellow from New York (Harrison). Interested in taking singing lessons.

did.unittitle: M. Mosby Williams to Hon. J.Innes Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request you fill out enclosed form. (Questionaire for "Genealogy of the Heirs of Harriet C. Hare")

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Court work being done, so stay abroad as long as you desire.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Tomorrow is Thanksgiving - going to Yale and Princeton football game in New York. Exercising and studying.

did.unittitle: James T. Mitchell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of tribute to Judge Allison and hope you will not resign even though you are entitled to. Confidential talk with Governor on successor to Judge Clark (deceased) and conversation turned to rumor of your resignation. Court getting on easily, so don't come home until you're ready.

did.unittitle: Samuel Chew to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sad that Yale beat us at football. Christmas wishes.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enjoying Willing's company, but being in mourning cannot do anything pleasant for him. After Christmas going to devote myself to music.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Among first 40 in class of 250. Going to Philadelphia tomorrow and will stay at Grandpapa's house.

did.unittitle: Ethel Phelps to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Piano and singing lessons, French, French history and riding. Plan to leave Paris in February, go up Nile and return by way of Italy and back to Paris the 1st of May.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accumulation of letters - Aug. 30 - to Mamma from Willing. Riding (sorry looking beast). Rode to Cabin Home and describes it. Shooting with Beau Westfeldt. Wants to see Vanderbilt's place. Request for clothes. (On a vacation, probably North Carolina. Sept. 30 - Mamma from Emily. Business to be attended to before starting abroad. Comments on Mr. Hare's health. Willing's rooms and exams. About Swedish diplomat met at Bar Harbor and invited to stay with us, and also a young Harvard fellow who came. Nov. 11 - To Mamma from C.W. Hare, New Haven. Asked Grandpapa to give you the house in town. General news of activities at college. Dec. 26 - Mamma from Willing, Philadelphia, Pa. Miss you so this Christmas. Comfortable at Grandpapa's. Social events and people attending. Aunt Katy and Uncle Oliver angry over something. Christmas gifts. Uncle Charley not well and going to California.

did.unittitle: Wayne MacVeagh to J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will meet with friends on subject of your resignation, but foresee the result - ask you to retain your place until you are sure.

did.unittitle: D. Newton Fell to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Myself, Judge Pennypacker and Mr. MacVeagh agree that your resignation should not be sent to the Governor now.

did.unittitle: Wayne MacVeagh to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dismiss the thought from your mind of resigning at present time.

did.unittitle: Anna Tilghman to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Maria, Betsy, William, myself and 2 servants have had influenza or grippe (an epidemic). All about family and friends. Ellen de Cuelebroeck.

did.unittitle: Samuel W. Pennypacker to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mr. MacVeagh, Judge Fell and myself met and feel you should not resign now and continue your vacation until Fall if you wish. Work being done satisfactorily.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On loneliness (much about Faith in God and you'll never be alone). Her feeling's about "Reverendy's" engagement. An accident (fall) made everyone so attentive to me.

did.unittitle: Katherine W. Cheston to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Uncle and Grandmother Cheston died, so will not "come out" until next winter (we will be debutantes together). About friends.

did.unittitle: _______ ? to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Activities since you left.

did.unittitle: W.W. Montgomery (nephew) to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On business. Enclosed blank power of attorney and blank check. Also account. Rev. Hunt resigned rectorship of St. Martins due to ill health and succeeded by Rev. W.S. Baer.

did.unittitle: George Hall, Jr. to Mrs. Emily P. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Statement of account.

did.unittitle: Sarah to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About Willing at home for holidays.

did.unittitle: Sarah and Bridget to Mrs. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On Willing at home for holidays. About house and things at home.

did.unittitle: Katharine W. Cheston to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About Molly's looks on the night of the 1st Assembly. Also a description of Virginia and Mary Thorndike and the dinner and flowers.

did.unittitle: Mary Robert Coles to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing and social events (1st Assembly and Ellen Harrison's dance and other events.) Fire at Williams on 15th St.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very gay during holidays. Harrison's Ball - description of decorations, girls and their clothes, etc.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Met Miss Cheston at Molly's tea. Ellen Harrison and Edyth Wain getting attention because Mother's entertain so much. Poor Molly Coles and Virginia have "ratty looking men attentive to them". Miss Fischer and Miss Tyson "the belles". Sam sick during holidays. William's dance very stupid. William's fire. Mr. Welling, Cass's father, died. Uncle Charlie dissatisfied with America set sail for the "old world". Mr. Nichols "called" to a church in St. Louis.

did.unittitle: George Hall, Jr. to Mrs. Emily P. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Statement of account. Have not been able to rent either house, 120 S. 22nd St. or 254 S. 21st.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: When will Trux be able to go out. Impossible to see Pope.

did.unittitle: W.W. Montgomery (nephew) to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acct. of Drexel & Co., and explanation of his account with you.

did.unittitle: Mildred to Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About being in Venice and now in Paris, riding and driving.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visit to a volcano.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Doctor took Truxtun's nurse, but she returned in a few hours. Queen passed by. Sightseeing and shopping. Got flowers from Shelly and Keat's graves.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Hon. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has been "suspended", but thinks with tutors can pass exams in June. Awaiting your decision.

did.unittitle: E.B.M. to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Alice, Bertha and I have been bedfast. Miserable weather. Family and friends.

did.unittitle: Nannie Gilpin to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rush to get there and what they are doing.

did.unittitle: Horace B. Hare to Master T. Truxtun Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: What he's doing - volcano, Pompeii, Vesuvius and Sorrento.

did.unittitle: Horace Binney Hare to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad to hear of Truxton's first walk. Bay of Naples, Pompeii, and Grandpapa found rooms at Sorrento. Aunt C. is much better.

did.unittitle: Charlotte Coxe to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Papa bought house on Spruce St. Grandmama's house being torn down. All about friends and activities.

did.unittitle: Zempt Freres to Mrs. Hare
Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent photo to Willing. Gave up salon and bedroom and moving into nurse's room to cut expenses. Gave Mazzieri "a piece of my mind".

did.unittitle: Mary Harrison to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Father returned to Americabut will join us for summer. Met Daisy and Mr. Whitewash in Venice and Paris several times. Sorry to hear of Truxton's scarlet fever. Trip north to Holland.

did.unittitle: Emily Rawle to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Might possibly meet you in Paris in autumn. Public fighting Traction Co. who want to run street cars with overhead electric wires in Phila. Inquiries of Ducky's illness.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: See if you can get me a straw sailor hat. My shirt is lost.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Just got word you have consented to my studying at Milford under tutor. Sorry for "suspension". Will study hard.

did.unittitle: Lily to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Easter card.

did.unittitle: E.B.M. (sister) to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry for you and Truxtun confined with scarlet fever, and concern over Constance's bronchitia. News of family and friends.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Uncle Ned coming up, and I go Thursday to Milford to live with clergyman. Hope to "pull" through and get back with class.

did.unittitle: Andrew to Hon. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Care of the place at home - cows, horses, dogs and planting.

did.unittitle: Katharine W. Cheston to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for photo. Going abroad with Bessy Farnum and then going to join Aunt and Uncle. Went to New Orleans to Mardi Gras and Florida. Concerts and theatre. To Boston for a wedding. About Molly.

did.unittitle: W.W. Montgomery (nephew) to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paying taxes and about bond. Man helping Andrew, and new preacher at St. Martins.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived Palermo. Exposition poor and stupid.

did.unittitle: C.H. to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On journey with Constance, Mrs. Beale and Emily. Emily unhappy. Will meet you in Sorrento. Keep boys studying. Going to Taormina.

did.unittitle: C.H. to Mrs. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant trip - taking it easy for health.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nice journey here but want to be with you. Grandpapa enjoying everything.

did.unittitle: Aunt Constance to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Stockings. Grandpapa enjoying himself so much, but your Mother and I impatient to get north.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wanted to come to you sooner, but have to wait till all come. Aunt Katy has a little boy.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request to stay at "Harford", Radnor, Pennsylvania this summer. Doing best at lessons, but as Grandpapa says "deeds not words must show in the future". Clipping enclosed on death of classmate.

did.unittitle: Albert Stopford to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Been busy moving into house.

did.unittitle: Horace B. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Met Miss Brown and two Chew girls. Leave tomorrow for Bolognia and then to Venice. Saw national ball game of Italy.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw all old friends at Rome. Journey from Rome to Florence. "Doings" and friends. Sam Chew inherited old homestead "Cliveden" and Ben Chew speaks of Sam as "Esther's devoted".

did.unittitle: Axel Muntry ? to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advising you to take your boys out of Italy and go to Switzerland. If necessary get Miss Yanes ? to take care of him.

did.unittitle: Violet M. Hope to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sights they are seeing.

did.unittitle: Supplement de La Revue
2nd Supplement - Journal de Vevey.
Horace B. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The place and people there. Truxton delighted with suit.

did.unittitle: George Hall, Jr. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Statement of your account.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miss you. Accounts of people seen. Had woman about hats (she put mine on and I can "never take it off") She was very entertaining. Silk arrived - what shall I do with it? New maid. Tracy's visited me.

did.unittitle: E.C.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request you find Rudolph Meyer at Carlsbad and inquire about box that was to be sent. Your Mother arrived safely. Hope you will be better "for the cure."

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enjoyed Villars - walked and climbed mountain with Truxton. Do not like this place, but have to stay here with Grandmama. About getting home for school.

did.unittitle: Emily to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Box has been sent to Paris. Willie Robbins stealing. Esther and I feeling better with the iron water.

did.unittitle: Charlotte to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anne Fisher with us here. Bathing, hot weather, Eliza Kane's engagement, books and tennis. Photo enclosed.

did.unittitle: Map of Karlsbad
Horace B. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Others left for Germatt. Heard from Truxtun and what he's doing. I walked with others to Villars. About getting a dog. Grandpapa sailing the 17th of September.

did.unittitle: E.C.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for seeing about box. About crowds at the spring. Traveling experiences.

did.unittitle: Katherine to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived home from abroad. Now paying Molly a visit.

did.unittitle: A. Muntry ? to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has to remain to take care of Lord Virren who is seriously ill. Recommend nurse, Miss Yane's ? , to anyone who needs a nurse - she needs help.

did.unittitle: Cass to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Missing all of you. About "old maid" she's with. Church and how lovely it is there.

did.unittitle: Katharine W. Cheston to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Has enjoyed time abroad, but has to go home. Going to visit West Virginia and Annapolis. And a note of "welcome home" and invitation to visit.

did.unittitle: Horace B. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cholera scare. Truxton and I went to Oberhorn sea and Brilhom Glacier. Look for a poodle.

did.unittitle: Gabriela _______ ? to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request that you might escort her daughter to America.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on the doctors and "the cure" (diet and iron water). About losing your luggage, rooms, weather, runaway horses and carriage, Mrs. Judson and her family, the boy's schooling and Willing, Villars and the people there, the new maid, and Mr. Hare's passage home.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Did not deepen friendship with Miss Martin who she was with at Blue Mt. Lake. Cholera quarantines. Still looking forward to marriage at her age. On Longfellow's "Hiawatha".

did.unittitle: ________ Hope to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travels and sights.

did.unittitle: Ridie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw opera "Cavaliera Rusticana" and "Amico Fritz". Mamma has troublesome eye. Lena's lover. And notes from Emily and Lena. (Sweet peas enclosed)

did.unittitle: ______ Hope to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staying with cousin, owner of Abbotsford and great granddaughter of Sir Walter Scott.

did.unittitle: Emily (Bebo) to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Bon voyage".

did.unittitle: Mary Roberts Coles to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Welcome home. Wants to see you and hopes you and she can have lunch with K. Cheston. Dogs.

did.unittitle: C. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Very lonesome.

did.unittitle: Charles S. Du Riche Preller to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notice of change of name - from Charles Sheibner to Charles S. Du Riche Preller.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: If you have any news of family sailing, let me know. Plans for leaving Tuesdays vacant all winter for one day of leisure. St. Agnes Guild reading - wish you would do the same with Esther and friends. Comments on Ruskin (author).

did.unittitle: John L. Cadwalader to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Was going to see you today, but could not with Emily's life drawing to a close, (his sister).

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry to hear of your Mother's friend's death. Wants to know all about your "tea". Has new nephew. Riding and riding habits.

did.unittitle: P. Colomba to Mrs. Horace B. Hare
John A. Kasson to Mrs. Emily P. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Declining invitation to dinner and dance.

did.unittitle: Cass to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for you and Conny to Annual Service of St. Agnes Guild.

did.unittitle: Murray Blight Rush to Miss Hare

scopecontent.p: Thank you for match box.

did.unittitle: Truxtun Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Cricket and money.

did.unittitle: Truxtun Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

did.unittitle: Truxtun Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

did.unittitle: John Hone to Mrs. H.B. Hare

did.unittitle: Duck to Mrs. H.B. Hare

did.unittitle: Willing & Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. H.B. Hare

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staying abroad for winter for Edmund's health. Description of place and Gounod's and MacMahon's funerals. Children's studies. Comments on Philadelphia and schools. Excitement of Russian visitors to Paris. Observance of anniversary of Marie Antoinette's execution. Friends.

did.unittitle: Horace Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: On your coming. Stand 12th in class of 20. School and football.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Please come visit. Shubrick and George with me for winter. May has moved into London from country.

scopecontent.p: Went to Chicago. Spent Sunday at Arthur Little's. In Chicago saw many friends from Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Description of place. Walking, driving and sailing. Also reading aloud. Mr. Hare's gout attack in foot. Glad to hear Esther is better. About Ellen's "doing" my dresses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans to go fishing soon. Have been detained by "gout".

scopecontent.p: Inquiry as to when you're coming up, and have you paid Merion Club dues.

scopecontent.p: Activities and friends there. Coming home next week. Advise servants to be prepared. Bought oranges. Mr. Hare and Connie fishing. Excursions.

scopecontent.p: Was in Scotland for Christmas. Thank you for calendar. Social events and activities. Comments on travels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Measles.

scopecontent.p: Hope you will soon be alright and come up. Things to bring with you.

scopecontent.p: Misses Horace. Weather.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sights and travels. Lizzie Coxe, and health. Comments on children. Willing on editorial staff of Ledger, the Ledger itself, the Civic Club of Philadelphia, and the Salvation Army. Tells of her cousin Angelina and family and of seeing the Pope.

did.unittitle: Duck to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Was in hospital for one week and only in bed 3 days.

did.unittitle: Duck to Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clothes he wants sent up. Pajamas arrived. Needs money. Tennis and baseball. Still has bad cold (had measles). Went bicycling - saddle broke and had to walk 6 miles back.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Weather and baseball. Needs thin underclothes and money. Had easy time with measles. Been invited to Mr. Little's at Swampscott - should I accept?

scopecontent.p: Outing to Groton game. Send clothing and money.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to visit.

scopecontent.p: Grieved to hear of your illness. Accepting Mr. Hare's invitation to visit Radnor.

did.unittitle: N________ ? to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Anxious you carry out your plan to come over to Paris. Voyage over and people met. Travels abroad. Operas.

scopecontent.p: Can't you change your mind about going? Will take package to Mr. Bayard.

scopecontent.p: Harry Mercer sails either Saturday or Wednesday. Lunched with Miss McCaul wants to visit you at Harford.

scopecontent.p: Invitation to visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Disaappointed could not see you before I sail.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Maria had scarlet fever. ... funeral. Mary Astor has sent ... her Opera Box for 3 nights. ...to Lady Jersey's garden party. Weir to address medical students. Other social activities.

did.unittitle: Cass to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wants you to come to New York. Dicky will be out to farm on Friday and take you out. "Fairy godmother wishes" for you and Molly.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Do let Esther stay at Pojac. Hoping the "pain in your side" better, and that you understand my motives for staying in town (duties in the slums).

did.unittitle: H.C. Mercer to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expecting to sail on "Campania". Hoping to see you in England.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Temperature here 96 degrees. If one of boys stay with Grandmama, I will come spend Sunday with you.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Heard from Miss Hutchinson of your illness which has prevented you from coming abroad. Friends seen. News of travels. Edmund's health. Heading for Paris before sailing for home.

did.unittitle: Rie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Having most enjoyable time with fellows "spooning".

did.unittitle: Rie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thinks John Jenks is "very much gone on me". Bertie Francine ?, "the great lion", actually walked with me and sat with me. Having great fun.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dr. Gerhard advises you stay away from Philadelphia heat as long as possible. Been reading to Grandmama. Possibility of job on editorial staff. Two weeks vacation.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Experience in getting rooms and activities in Bar Harbor - dining and driving with friends. News of family and friends. Glad you are coming to Bar Harbor and that Esther and Willing are to be at the Coles at Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Begins editorial duties at once. Plans for vacation at Bar Harbor. Boys and Grandmama well.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for going up to Bar Harbor. Will bring E's dress.

did.unittitle: Rie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Private" - all about her boy friends, "spooning", etc.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Home news. Someone has a "swimming tank" at Devon.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had lovely time here. Wants to hear from you.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived home after good journey. Had afternoon tea in Mr. Thompson's private car. About boys joining you or other plans for them before returning to school.

did.unittitle: Duck to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to Atlantic City. Tennis.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On the boys' studies. Anxious for your return.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Day at cricket with Cassatt's and Mr. John Harrison, and tea in the evening with Aunt Maria. Dinner yesterday with Jimmy Paul where the Miss Hargis' ? are staying (daughters of French banker). Why don't you go to North Carolina with Aunt Katy. No invitations to second cricket match. Your account at bank overdrawn. Truxtun "run down".

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deposited check. About boys and schooling. Can play golf now at Bessy Chew's.

did.unittitle: Supreme Court of Roofing (G. Ginley & Co.) to ______

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subpoena.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for you and Esther to spend week at Drifton. Eliza and Charlotte not well, and Edmund unable to go to school (do you know of a tutor?)

did.unittitle: Truxtun to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for cravat for birthday. Practicing football. Playing left guard.

did.unittitle: M.M.C. to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expecting you Monday. Polly expects to meet you on train and has mileage books so you only need to get tickets to Jenkintown.

did.unittitle: M.M. Coxe to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Polly's going to wait and come up with you, and so expect you on Wednesday. Attie McClellan to come. We'll hear all the latest court news from the Ambassadress.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for mileage books. Will send your silver soap box and "lorgnon". Charlotte will visit you. (Keep E's secrets secret).

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Halloween. Outing to Providence and Agawan Hunt. All about her horse, Harry, and whether or not she should ride in Hunt. Susette Collins. Activities - rides, golf, scalloping, walks and mushroom hunts. Visitors - Madeline Goddard, Bessie Ward, Francis E. Ward, Mr. Conkling and Dick. Nelly's wedding.

did.unittitle: Harold Ellis Yamay to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for note. Am leaving and will miss you and Willing.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Practicing foorball. Truxtun well. Made divan for room - need cushions and shoe bag. Don't see how you think Rufus King is not the right kind of fellow. Got lost bicycling to Concord.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charlotte cannot accept invitation to Harford as she has shopping for clothes that has to be done. Will take season ticket to concerts if you really can spare it.

did.unittitle: Duck to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clearing snow off football field only to have it snow again which will probably postpone Groton game.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for dresses and shirt waists. Staying in town in house without tenant, and losing so much of Connie's visit. Elsie sick. Had to go with Daisy for her music lesson as chaperone (teacher is charming).

did.unittitle: H.B.H. to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Groton game - Truxtun played and we won (first time to beat them in 20 yrs.)

did.unittitle: R.W.G. Welling to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would love to dine with you, and about seats for show.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Suzette and riding. Horse (Harry). What's your impression of Mr. H.? E. to be married in January. Lily sang in Oratoria last night.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for box. Heard from Willing that whole family had taken to "bicycles and bloomers".

did.unittitle: OLiver Perry Smith to Aunt Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ride in pony cart. Dancing school.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanksgiving box delightful. Haircut. Coming home for Christmas holidays.

did.unittitle: M.R.C. to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Homesick. Golf. Grippe. Sights and travels.

did.unittitle: Cass to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Christmas card.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Need more cushions and shoe bag, and have Truxtun's and my suits and accessories cleaned and sent to us for dance. Sleighing and skating. English professor read "Mid-Summer Night's Dream" before school.

did.unittitle: Mary Roberts Coles to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for calendar and photograph. Really enjoying Rome. Taking Italian lessons, sightseeing and found many people we know. Dazzled at the diplomatic reception given by Mr. MacVeagh. Hope to begin bicycling. Had to have old mare, Virginia, killed and about other horses. Hope to meet you over here in the spring.

did.unittitle: Horace Wylie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry cannot accept invitation to Mitchell's.

did.unittitle: Katharine to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Of friends and memories, travels, sights, bicycling, and skating.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Feeling better. When you send black jacket could you send a shoe bag. And a letter to Addie from "Duck".

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry you had grippe. Truxton and I better. Mrs. Mills son here. Tell Willing shirt studs came.

did.unittitle: The Chapel Alley Daily Bulletin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: School paper.

did.unittitle: Edward Beale to Mrs. H. B. Hare
