did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two requests - say something nice for me when you call on Heckslur's and buy violets from me for your Ma. Should I send Conny's Hudnut parcel?

did.unittitle: ______ Ingham to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of voyage from Bermuda to Gibraltar. Four gulls have stayed with ship all the way. (Poem enclosed). (Was on the "Resolute" in 1878 with Mr. Hare)

did.unittitle: ______ to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to Second Assembly. (compliments of Mrs. John Jacob Astor)

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Think Mamma is on "the mend". Cassatt's and Cuyler's on way South - you will probably meet. Have cold and not going to ball - Elsie trying to get someone e;se to take her. (Also short note from Mother.)

did.unittitle: Willing to MIss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mamma improving. Refused Drexel's invitation for both of us. Tell Grandpapa that Grandmama is well.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "On the mend" - taking medicine of a tar mixture and inhaling tar steam. Willing's bronchitis is better. Aunt Katy only visitor I've been allowed to see. Dr. Pepper does not think anything the matter with Grandma B., and called her a "fraud" for sending for him.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mamma better. We played backgammon. Have had lots of visitors. Aunt Katy spending time between Grandmama B. and here. Think Mamma should join you when she is stronger.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clothes arrived in time for dance which was fun. Horace danced German with Bessie Wells and I with a Miss Butler (stupidest girl I ever met).

did.unittitle: Mother to MIss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wishing she were with you. Grandma B. quite well. I feel better but can't sleep - still receiving flowers. Willing still in house, but better.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: News of family and friends at home. Mamma and I both improved.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mother, Grandma B. and I improving. Everyone interested in "Life of Philadelphia" which Mrs. Harrison is getting up. Uncle Ned asked to take part of Lord Howe.

did.unittitle: H.C. Mercer to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interesting letter on adventures (digging ruins). (University of Pennsylvania Department of Archaeology and Palaeontology.)

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mamma had relapse, but Dr. Pepper thinks it unwise for you to return to Philadelphia, so stay until Grandpapa returns. All improving.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Miss Esther Hare

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials note
separatedmaterial.p: Telegram - "Mama improving - still in her room - weather very bad."

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Worried about you and wish you could be down here. Have become quite intimate with Mrs. Cassatt. Other friends here - Christine Cadwalader, Mrs. Biddle, Mr. and Mrs. John Harrison (he with gout so bad has to be wheeled about) and Mrs. Sharpless.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: So busy with church activities, could I come after Easter? Think you should read Dr. Satterlee's book "A Creedless Gospel, and the Gospel Creed", and suggest others, (one by Augustus Hare). Bebo getting settled in new home.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of place. Bathing, church, flowers, rowing, eclipse of moon, and wants to know really how you are.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Getting well, but still no visitors. Willing quite well now.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Miss E. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - "Mama much better. Will sit up on Sunday. Don't worry."

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sailing and friends. There are some distinguished guests here - a German Baron and Prince.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About her illness - sixth week in bed but now getting better. Comment about Prince "would rather land him than a fish".

did.unittitle: Mary Roberts Coles to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to Paris and expect to meet you there this Spring. Really liked Rome. General travel news. Concern over your Mother and wants to hear from you.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: You are to be bridesmaid in Willing wedding and dance in Lafayette Ball with Jo Glidden in Mrs. Harrison's effort to make money for University of Pennsylvania. Mother sat up today and getting well.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry she came, jealous of Willing and hurt because no one let her know how you really were. Grandpapa disappinted in fishing at Ft. Pierce. Program of the "Ormond Serenaders".

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Esther and I so worried about you, but your letter assures us you are "on the mend". Were coming home two days early, but could not get drawing room on train.

did.unittitle: C.W. Beale to E.F. Beale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Detailed account of Beale family. Wants to find out where great, great grandfather, John Beale was buried. Billingsgate London named after the family. (Requests $25. apiece from family to continue)

did.unittitle: C.W. Beale to Emily
Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Why don't you go abroad? Deaths. Dr. Satterlee's book. Poem - "Song of the Sparrow".

did.unittitle: Duck to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Got here this morning after 2 weeks of gaiety.

did.unittitle: Court of Quarter Sessions, Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cases of License Court - granting licenses. (Judge Hare only judge - Judge Thayer not setting on bench).

did.unittitle: Newspaper Article

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Lawyers will urge that more than one Judge sit". "Judge Hare sits alone".

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Addie said you are going to Atlantic City. On your comment about "catching a rich girl", my friend Winnie Mayo said "something of the sort must happen as he was one of those unfortunates with a champagne taste and beer income". Another play.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Captain of Corridor baseball nine. School news.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiry after Mamma. Clothes, etc. to be sent up. Thinks he will either be Macbeth or Juliet in next play.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rainy Easter. Man to come from Boston to measure to alter some clothes. Truxton captain, and I, manager, of "Corridor Nine".

did.unittitle: Madie to Aunt Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Child's letter to aunt.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad to hear you have gone to Atlantic City and are improving. Baseball, speaking before school, and reading "Cicero".

did.unittitle: Memorial

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Eckley Brinton Coxe (died - May 13, 1895). Poem- John S. McGroarty.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Interested in plans for summer. Bought shoes. Send hat and duck trousers.

did.unittitle: Duck to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ride to Auburndale. Beaten at Groton game. Horace made a splendid girl in play.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wish I could go to Europe with you. Think you might like Conan Doyle's book "Around the Red Lamp". Bicycling, women's suffrage, and babies.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Foolish for me to go to Yale, so have decided to take exam for Harvard. Have bought blue serge suit from Brooks, New York which will do till I meet you in London.

did.unittitle: M.P. Mitchell to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaving for Bar Harbor and so glad you are coming there.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw play "Trilby". Saw Aunt Maria and Grandmama Beale. I came here and am bicycling. About friends - John Ingham, Frank Bond, Mrs. Harry Markoe, Harry, Mrs. Gardner Cassatt and Lalla Paul.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to Chelsea where Oliver and I went to Atlantic City. Came home because Louise is coming. Bought blue linen and blue serge for dresses. Polly coming for 4th.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boys to arrive at Harford today. Bicycling, swimming. Boys reports came - Truxtun first in his form and third in the school. Horace also did well.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Out here with Mamma. Katie off to North Carolina - at train we lost Tom. Polly Coxe coming out this afternoon.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived home yesterday. Polly and Ridie and friend coming to dinner. Willing went to dinner with Cassatt's. Want to come to Bar Harbor and think one of us should go with Addie.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Fourth of July and visit at Mr. Little's. Grandpa and Grandma come tomorrow - end of gaiety.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Fourth of July gay. Grandparents expected tomorrow - so will settle down to "Harford life".

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Packed the things - silver, linen and clothes. Plans for coming to Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad you got cottage. Esther, Truxtun and Ida will go up Friday and get house ready. Grandmama trying to decide what to do - thinks she needs more of a "change".

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Terrific heat. Spent last evening at Haverford with Uncle Ned (hearing of his driving trip). Colt. Plans for summer "juggling around" Truxtun and I.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandmama decided to go to Bar Harbor. Letter to H. Mercer in Yucatan last winter returned. Bicycling. Plans for coming up. Met very pretty, weathy girl at Jimmy Paul's. Having Jimmy, Lalla and Ridie to dinner.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for all to Bar Harbor - Grandparents, Horace, Harry Mercer, Grandma B., Aunt C., and myself.

did.unittitle: Alice C. Frazier to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to see son's paintings.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for Bar Harbor and activities at home.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staying here for week, then will go home and stay with Willing until time to go to Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Harry accepts your invitation - he just got back from 52 mile bicycle trip searching for cave. Thanks for shirts. To dine with Uncle Ned (the Gardner Cassatt's to be there). Will ask John Ingham to stay with me again.

did.unittitle: Horace to Ms. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About plans on where he should go from there.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reference to Harry's visit to you at Bar Harbor, and mine to the Cole's there. Mrs. Cassatt "crazy" for you to go abroad with her. John Ingham comes out occasionally and I confine his drinking to claret.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lost bracelet - "look through Ida's things as she used to take things at Grandmama's". Uncle Oliver returned and staying at Harford. Plans on leaving for Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: E. _____. _____. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Confidential" - Quotes from letter from Ridie about you.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived home yesterday. Journey home.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: To see dentist tomorrow and plans for coming up to Bar Harbor. School. Cannot find your bracelet.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Arrived back in Philadelphia. Aunt Maria invited me to Atlantic City. Enjoyed Bar Harbor with you.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Death of Dan Coxe. Invitation to you to come to Drifton.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found Harford "as I left it". Going to boat race. Keep Horace till 25th - Truxton will arrange for room at school and meet you in Boston. Truxtun riding colt.

did.unittitle: Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to New York to boat race with Anderson on government boat. Your plans for going abroad - talk over plan of taking Horace.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hot and no rain - everything burnt up. School begins next week. Went to Atlantic City with Aunt Ridie. Grandpapa not well so has not begun court yet. He put me on $300. allowance.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hot weather. No yacht race so am going to Atlantic City with Uncle Ned. Truxtun, tennis and colt.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will make deposit Tuesday. Sure Grandpapa will think it sensible for Horace to stay for his health - tell him to stop all smoking. Will send medicine.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Helen to visit in October. Sorry you couldn't come in September. Will you and Esther come next week? Drought. Request that Willing take the part of Colonel Bouquet bidding farewell to Anne Willing (played by Charlotte in New York in Historical Tableau).

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Under care of doctor for nervous prostration. Colonial papers - could not get Power book from England, but still seeking information.

did.unittitle: Maria Beale to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending papers although incomplete. Would you get three sets of blanks for pedigrees to fill out for children.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Church work and vacation. Lonesomeness and romantic interests.

did.unittitle: Edward Beale to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Business on Bloomingdale note.

did.unittitle: Compliments of R.W.G. Welling

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article - "The Question of Good Government: Post Election Reflections" by Paul Fuller. (Corruption - Tammany)

did.unittitle: Grandma Beale to Horace & Truxton Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Congratulations on scholarship and athletics. "Literary" abilities. Family news.

did.unittitle: Matilda Markoe to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Meeting Molly. Maria entertaining royalty.

did.unittitle: Edward Beale to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Referring to monies held for you by me.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Whether or not to go with you. (If absolutely needed will go, but nothing but your necessity "would make me think it right to go.")

did.unittitle: M.R.C. to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending you a pen. "Bon Voyage".

did.unittitle: Duckie to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Return trip to school and about your trip abroad.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trip back to school. Snow and cold. Would like to go to Harvard after Christmas. "Bon Voyage".

did.unittitle: Polly Coxe to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - "Bon Voyage".

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sad at your leaving. Went to Wellings and saw Grandmama and Aunt C., went to theatre with them and Mrs. W. to see "Heart of Maryland."

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cass still in bed. Lovely having Connie and Mrs. B. with us. Social activities.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: After writing you, went to lunch at Wellings. Hadn't intended to go to Grants, but felt had to go for short visit. Then went to Astor's who were not at home, and the Vanderbilts who were also out of town. Then dined at Drexel's (comments on them). Weather, Grandmama, Grandpapa and the Welshe's and the house.

did.unittitle: Polly Coxe to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appreciate your asking me to go with you, although could not go. Social activities.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Quite ready to move into town - country gloomy. Saw Dr. Pepper and appear to be okay in every way. Social activities and duties at home - paying bills, etc.

did.unittitle: Mary R. Coles to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw Willing and hopes when he moves into town to see him oftener. Social events and friends. Christmas and New Year's wishes.

did.unittitle: Ridie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dresden doll in play for University of Pennsylvania which is fun. Received invitation to boys' dance and hopes Aunt Connie will take us. Friends. Dancing lessons funny.

did.unittitle: Mother to The Messrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: To arrive at Gilbralter tomorrow. Good voyage. Discussing football with Truxtun.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received cable of your arrival at Gibralter. Refused Harry's invitation as boys will be home. Hope to join you abroad in summer. Mr. Bayard's speeches in England about political abuse have been attacked for unpatroitism. About friends.

did.unittitle: ______ di Villamarine ? to Mrs. and Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing was here. Cass still in bed. Don't get blue, you went after long and mature consideration.

did.unittitle: Katharine Livingston to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Welcome to this side of ocean, and hope we can meet here before going home. People she's met.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Home for holidays. I at Grandma B's and Horace at 118. Motormen on strike (no cars running). Molly Welling has pneumonia and Aunt Connie may go to her.

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A.B.) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sad over your leaving. Want details of your voyage. Gen. Grieve visited (95 now). Willing informed us of your "getting off". Social affairs - dinners, guests, theatre, opera, etc. Molly and Mrs. Welling have colds and Cassie still in bed. Emily has "bicycle knee". Going home tomorrow. Dec. 23 - Letter interrupted because Mrs. Welling became so ill. Truxton with us Horace at 22nd St. Trolley strike to end. Excitement over Mrs. McCall's tea for Mrs. Mercer. Molly Welling has pneumonia, but danger seems over. Plans for Christmas.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boys home. Horace has trouble with nose and going to specialist. I and Horace comfortable at Grandpapa's. Truxtun at Grandma B's but will come here when Hatch arrives. Sent Dr. Mitchell's book. Street car strike over (disturbances). The Cassatt's will be in Rome in February. Dr. McLane of Carlsbad was here looking for you.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At home sleeping in back office of Grandpapa's. Christmas not merry. Going to see Irving in "Lion's Mail", and to dance at Merion Club. Came to Atlantic City with Grandpapa as there's nothing to do in city. Cyril Hatch coming. Miss Bispham engaged to Tom McKane. Play a success, and will send photos of me in skirts.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to dine. Also a card - lunch at the American Ambassaders.

did.unittitle: Elsie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for dress.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for your Christmas check and Esther's match box. Dance at Merion Cricket Club, card party at Mrs. Drayton's and Irving at theatre.

did.unittitle: ______ to Mrs. H. B. Hare & Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitations while in Rome 1896.

did.unittitle: Polly Coxe to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace and Truxtun were here to dinner. Theatre party, Sophomore Dance and other social events. John Howe's death. Consuelo Marlborough ill in Rome with typhoid.

did.unittitle: Katharine Livingston to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delighted with your picture. Having portrait painted by Frau von Kaulbach's husband. Papa has jaundice. Plans for meeting you somewhere.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anxious about you (no letters). Badick's ball stupid-only amusement was watching engaged couple, K. Bispham and T. McKean. Grandpapa got letter from Mr. McVeagh who is enchanted at having you and Mamma in Rome. Home news and social events.

did.unittitle: Molly Welling to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Been ill a long time with lung trouble. News of Mamma, Cass, Dick, Lily and Bebo. Hope to go to Cinderella Cotillion. Received exquisite pin from Jo Hayes for Christmas. Mamma will need a change so they will make me go although I don't want to.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Christmas gifts. Welshes comfortable in your house. C. Hatch came. He and Horace at Grandma B's and Truxtun here. Went to Radnor - skating and turkey dinner. Grandmama has rheumatism. Irving in "King Arthur" and Louis XI". Comments on war scare. Harry's confiding in me on Susie Willing. Social news.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boys look well. Depressed and unable to entertain. Social events. Schuylkill water black and smells. Death of John Howe.

did.unittitle: Edward Beale to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on your letters. Saw Horace & Truxtun at theatre seeing "Trilby". Drowning of John Stewardson skating on Schuylkill. About Welshes in your house. Mr. Bayard's trouble and Venezuelan difficulty - depressed business and stocks. Financial business.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Katharine Bispham's engagement. Social events. Going to try skating.

did.unittitle: Mother & Oliver Perry Smith to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A letter explaining about Oliver's letter enclosed. Oliver's letter just a note of wishes and what he got for Christmas.

did.unittitle: C.I. Hope to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Private" - Worry and anxiety over Violet's decision "not to return to me anymore".

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boys have gone back to school after holiday gaieties. Polly Coxe's theatre party, Grandma Beale's dinners and skating. John Stewardson's death by drowning while skating (newspaper article on it). Grandma Hare's rheumatism.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Christmas. Gave dinners for boys. Truxtun's poetry. (Note enclosed from Emily P. Beale - thank you for blanket.)

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account of Christmas holidays. Merion Cricket Club burnt down.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Matchcase, snow, the holidays, skating, theatre party, etc.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Holidays - dance, dinners, skating, etc. Sonnet writing - one enclosed.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horce Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Photos for you and Frances and Alice Rhinelander. Dr. Satterlee to be consecrated Bishop.

did.unittitle: Aunt Constance to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: News of friends, social affairs and family.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma's rheumatism better. Dinners at Grandma B.'s and the Chapmans. News of friends and family.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social affairs, visitors, luncheons, etc. Family news.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Girls in society - Helen Sanders (a tremendous belle), Mildred Waln, Polly and Charlotte Coxe. Mary Harrison engaged to Leary. Ridie's activities - studying and working at music. Hattie expects baby - Truxtun might return to her (she is a fiend). Friends in Europe. Scandal - Mrs. Dick divorced only a week ready to marry Mr. Gross.

did.unittitle: Ridie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Reserve a count for me". Reading Journal of Marie Baslikertseff. Wants one of those pinchey butterflies from Rome. Helen Sanders friendship and episode with flowers from Hare Wilke ? Other friends in society. (Photos enclosed)

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosed pincushion. Not going to Florida with Mrs. Beale and Connie. Taking social events slowly since illness.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Think we should rent Harford and boys could spend summer abroad. Grandpa will give $2000 towards summer expenses. Your bills. Still without waitress.

did.unittitle: J.I.C.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unless Mrs. Hare's condition changes, I shall resign in March and go abroad ("was born a free man and cannot make up to live in a land controlled by the Quays, Crkers ?, Platts, Gormans and Martins.) About renting "Harford". Weather.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing was here last night and read us some of your letters. Lunch with Mrs. Penrose. Visited Drexels and took along Gertrude McCall. Went with Charlotte to see "Gilbert" - a most indecent, improper woman. Visited Bispham's. Heckscher ran away with a girl and married, but family brought him back and made him marry her again. About your getting to see Pope. Newspaper article - "New York's Great Cycle Exhibition" in Madison Square Garden.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charlotte "crazier than ever" - stole one of my photographs. Asked Molly to dance the Cotillion at the Assembly, but can't find any girl that "really gives me a thrill". Harry working on another book. Grandma has engaged man to wait and look after Grandpapa and me and tend to furnace. Grandpapa going to Florida and then resign. Polly Coxe - "gem of whole family".

did.unittitle: Madie Perry Smith & Oliver Perry Smith to Aunt Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Children's letters to aunt.

did.unittitle: Mary R. Coles to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had "time of my life" on visit to Boston and New York. Dined last night at Mrs. Harry Coxe's and Willing took me in. Tonight I dance the Cotillion with him at the Assembly. Dinners, lunches, and friends.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Assembly, Mrs. Drexel's tea, Mrs. Ladinberg, friends, social affairs and family. Harry's idea about drifting on a houseboat down the Rhone River. About a wife, and a husband for Esther.

did.unittitle: Weir Mitchell to Mrs. Emily Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Weather, Stewardson's death, lecture at Radcliffe, Martin Brimmer's death and my new book ready for press.

did.unittitle: Mrs. French to Hon. Judge Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Resolutions of thanks to Hon. Judge J.I. Clark Hare" for good done in closing many wicked saloons.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friends, Assembly, Capt. Russell, and Edmund Lewis's - supper and music. Talk with Maria Coxe, opera, Attie's tea to meet Mrs. Gray, and news of other friends and family.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Funny to have our house rented. Grandpapa wants to go to Florida but can find no one to go with him. Social affairs. Margaret Dulles engagement - nobody ever heard of man. Hope you will be presented at court. Cousin Atty McClellan's dance. Trying to rent "Harford" for summer.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Unusually busy at social affairs - luncheons, dinners, opera, balls, teas, musicals, and accounts of many of them. Trying to make arrangements for you to see Pope. Charlie writing book, and Elsie has published a story. Ridie's talents - painting, music, writing, dancing and composing. Weather. See Willing often. About friends. Tells of Horace and Truxtun's last day in Philadelphia. Claude de la Roche Francis' lecture.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Was busy getting ready for dance which was success. Truxton to be in play "My Lord in Livery", and he gave speech on Transvaal Question on which he may win prize. Skating. Thanks for Christmas money.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Do you know anything about cushions delivered here? Hired Saunders brother as valet and waiter and Grandma B. is taking care of his poodles as Grandma Hare would not let him bring them here. Grandpa, Aunt C., Grandma Beale and the Wellings going to Florida. F. Bond and M. Tyson's engagement. Tom McKean, social events, and friends. Ocean steamer "St. Paul" ran ashore.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About your being presented at Court. General Warren to be in Rome. Maria Coxe miserable and they want her to go to South America. Social news. Guest at Morrell's and presented to Cardinal Satolli and Archbishop Ryan.

did.unittitle: Miss E.B. Hare to Aunt Maria

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: F. Bond's engagement to M. Tyson. Uncle Ned going to Benedick's Ball, and he wants answer from your Mother about Sioux City bonds. Coxe's going to Jamaica. Ridie 18 tomorrow. Other news of family and friends. (Photo enclosed - Ridie ? )

did.unittitle: Violet M. Hope to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: German, music, travels and friends.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Spend 2 days at Mercers. Mr. George Krumbhaar was there and quite sane now. Grandpa going to Florida with the women - Grandma Beale, Aunt C., Mrs. Welling and Molly. Grandma H. may go to Atlantic City.

did.unittitle: Katharine Livingston to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Won't be coming to Venice. Mary to join us. Plans. Ballet lessons.

did.unittitle: Notes on lecture at Coliseum
Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Only way I have to making more money is to "marry it". Ava Astor, Jack, Eliza Coxe and Brice girls. Grandpapa and party left for Florida. Uncle Charley at Grandma B's. Williams' left for Rome. Harry is over Susie Willing affair. Grandpa sent E. money to pay for her dress.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Successful play. About going to Harvard - Grandpapa said he would not have money and I was to go to University of Pennsylvania. Write about being presented at Court.

did.unittitle: Mara Palazroli to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notice - impossible to give your lessons. Return books and pay.

did.unittitle: Louisa W. Terry to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to tea.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Thursday at home" and other social affairs. Charlie arrived (Katy and he met and I begged them not to bring up past). He has written two books since Christmas. About your "presentation". Description of Lake Worth and people there. Ned's Maria "expecting" in April.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Talked with Grandmama about plans for boys' education, going abroad, renting Harford, and not to rent 120 S. 22nd next winter. Uncle Charlie returning to South. Harry Mercer hopes we will be able to manage houseboat scheme - he wants to leave country, disgusted with Congress' behavior in regard to Cuba. Williams' sailed for Naples (scared to death). Charley Gibson and De Morey (lecturers). Colonial Dames restored one of rooms in Old State House where Washington was inaugurated.

did.unittitle: Emily P. Hare to Dr. Mitchell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Winter in Rome - activities, the MacVeaghs, and presentation to Queen Margaretta.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Off on cruise to West Indies for health. Sights. After visiting Venezuela, can see nothing worth our fighting England about - "corrupt influence in Congress". Dangerous for us to land in Cuba owing to proposal of Congress to recognize rights rights of insurgents there. Social affairs during winter. Mr. Kelly, Edmund's tutor, and our maid Regina married (making love right under my nose). Death of Judge Henry Reed and engagement of Aleck Wood and Miss Geary.

did.unittitle: A.M. Basiley to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note trying to make arrangements to see you - has to speak to you about something that interests you.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About plans for family abroad. (If Harford is not rented, boys will have to remain at home.)

did.unittitle: Kitty Moelliss to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sights.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sleighing at Radnor with Sam Chew. Tea at McCall's and Mr. Thomson's interest in Mrs. McCall. Metropolitan Opera Co. About Grandpapa and party in Florida and discussing plans for boys.

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A.B.) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Activities and people there. The Vanderbilt's arrival and stay. Charlie's visit to and leaving Philadelphia. Satin skirt you left home. Plans for family's being abroad. Willing's dinner at my house. Anne Chew. Friends and family. Dance for wounded Italians in Abysinia.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coxe's return. Charlotte's description of Tom Biddle (queerest mortal). Cousin Attie's theatricals for her dog and cat asylum. The change in Mary Scott. Dinner at the Paul's.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma positively will not go abroad again, and plans indefinite about Grandpa, boys and myself. Nasty weather. About renting house. Gave a dinner at Grandma B's. Saunders hopeless as waiter. About friends, Mrs. Ralston, Harry, etc. Boys coming home for Easter holidays.

did.unittitle: Truxtun Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Successful dance although Philadelphia girls could not come. Plays - Horace splendid in both, and I was in one. Elected president of Athletic Association and an associate editor of school paper. Sports and theatre. About going to Yale. Mrs. Thayer has baby boy.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boys home. When at home Grandpa seems to go "all to pieces." Everything in unsettled state and Grandma and Grandpa's plans - a lot depends on whether Harford is rented. Aunt Maria gave birth to a girl and Uncle Ned disappointed about the sex.

did.unittitle: E. Beale to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Maria presented me with another girl.

did.unittitle: Louisa W. Terry to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to lunch.

did.unittitle: Program of Olympics - Athens
Angelina Basile to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Giving some information on the "Fanfulla".

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About birth of daughter (Hope Truxtun). About Hattie and Truxtun Beale's separation and the birth of a son to Hattie.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Can get the time off and money to come abroad, but as to rest of family, plans are still in a mixed condition. Had a good day at Radnor. Truxton not well. Cousin Attie's play came off. No offer yet for Harford. Virginia Coles engagement to George Robins.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandpapa wants to go abroad but Grandmama doesn't. Plans undecided about us going abroad and about our going to college. Out in country during vacation. I had to see doctors, and Grandpapa in bed with gout. News of home and family and friends.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advising not to return to Harford in July. Financing your expenses and helping Willing to come over. I want to come abroad but Mrs. Hare dreads sea voyage. Not sure of Mrs. Beale and Connie's plans. Willing - Plans for joining you.

did.unittitle: Charlotte to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trip to West Indies. Cousin Attie's plays. (Picture from W.I. enclosed)

did.unittitle: Ollie to Aunt Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Child's letter to aunt.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Finances. Welshes left house in good order. Grandma B. and Aunt C. have gone to New York to visit Wellings and think they will all go abroad. Grandpa and Grandma H. have gone to Atlantic City and think Grandma H. may go abroad too and take the boys. I'll come later. Harford has not been rented.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma Hare decided not to go abroad, so we move to Harford next week. Grandma B. and Aunt C., Grandpa H. and boys' plans very uncertain. Heard all about you at Cassatt's.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trip from Athens to Taormina and plans to go on to Venice.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Home, friends and school news in general. Truxtun valedictorian.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At Harford. Grandma H. given up all ideas of going abroad. Think Grandpa will go with Grandma B. and Aunt C. and Ridie for a short time and take Horace. Aunt Katy coming to stay with Grandma H. at Harford.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memories of Athens. Journey and sights.

did.unittitle: Edwin H. Egerton to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Giving recommendation and name and address of hotel keeper.

did.unittitle: Walter Lowrie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expressing pleasure of their company while in Greece and received "The Red Badge of Courage".

did.unittitle: Colombo Prouily ? to Madame
Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lily Platt bicycled by here and advised me to see Egypt. About plans for going abroad - still unsettled. Social events and friends. General chatter on your activities. Truxtun valedictorian of his class. Esther's romantic affair. Memorial day affair on the Schuylkill in barges.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for photos. Plans uncertain for summer.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for coming abroad with you. Katy and children to stay with Grandma H. when Grandpa, Grandma B., Aunt Connie and Ridie go abroad. Horace will either go with them or a week later. Grandpa wants to go to Norway (therefore plans for meeting you undecided). Positively cannot afford to take Truxton, so he will probably go with Grandma Hare to Cape May and then Maine. Invited to New York by editor of Herald for lovely day (bike?) riding along Hudson to Coney Island and then dinner. Tea at Mr. Frank Thomson's.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Preparations for sailing (plans still undecided). Social affairs with friends and family.

did.unittitle: Walter Lowrie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apology for thanking you for pictures you had not sent.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delighted we will see you so soon in Paris.

did.unittitle: Oliver Perry Smith, Jr. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Two letters from nephew.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Business about Second Street houses and money sent to you. Plans for sailing (everything still unsettled as Grandpa wants to go to Norway and Grandma Beale will not make plans until she reaches London). Aunt Katy to stay with Grandma H. About Truxtun Beale and his wanting a divorce.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mamma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for meeting Grandpa in London, but does not know whether he will be able to meet you.

did.unittitle: Walter Lowrie to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pictures arrived and I thank you again. Engagement of Professor Frothingham to Miss Post.

did.unittitle: T. and J.W. Johnson & Co. to Hon. J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account on sales of "Smith's Leading Cases" (4 vols.)

did.unittitle: Mother to Emily

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hated to leave London and you and Esther. First impression of boat very bad, but really one of the best and North Sea delightful.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant voyage. Instructions for Horace.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Met Harrison. Shipboard on North Sea. Description of Bergen. Received instructions from family where to meet them. Begging you to come to Norway. Met a cousin, one Earl Dishwater who had married a Hare.

did.unittitle: E.C.H. to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commenting on all the family travelers. Dislike of cats. Andrew has another baby (girl). Discussing Maggie.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace is with us. Heartsick over missing gala affairs in London, but enjoying this journey in Norway, but wanted both. Description of arrival of King of Sweden at our hotel and drives along fiords. Sights, experiences and people. Mr. Hare can arrange a journey with perfection and thoroughness, but his own way.

did.unittitle: Fred Kent to C.W. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hoping to see you.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: News of journey through Norway.

did.unittitle: Edward Yarnall to Mrs. C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sure you'll like Switzerland better than here. About friends, and hope we can meet in Switzerland.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mamma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to Copenhagen. Especially enjoyed Norway.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delightful trip through Norway. Horace caught cold - quite ill, but now better. Description of view from window in Stockholm and visit to Palace.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delighted with Stockholm - description of it. Palace. Swedish massage. Young Harrison (Horace's friend). Hotel rooms. Norway inexpensive and very enjoyable. Ridie bought new violin (old one). Sights. (Pictures of Stockholm).

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandpapa decided to stay longer. Plans for further travel.

did.unittitle: Aunt Maria to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delighted for Ridie to have this experience abroad. About Hope, Emily, Lena, Aunt Katie and Ridie. Trying to get visiting list in order - maybe will have a "tea". Nurse for baby and horses.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaving for Geneva and Mt. Blanc and expect to meet you in Interlaken.

did.unittitle: J.I.Clark Hare to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to Switzerland and hope we can meet you somewhere but haven't much time before sailing. Your allowance. Delighted with Norway and would like to go again.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will come to see you at Interlaken. Wish Willing could wait and sail with us.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About plans for meeting you - but have had no word from you.

did.unittitle: K.L. Sheidegg to Monsieur Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill.

did.unittitle: K.L. Scheidegg to Monsieur Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: All want to see you, but question as to where.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travels and social affairs. Descriptions of cities and people. Russians charming. Philadelphians at Homburg. Taking "cures". Friend died - Olivia Clemens (Mark Twain's daughter).

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Journey, ballet, clothes and instructions for Horace.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Safely on board. Instructions for Horace when in London.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enjoyed being with you at Vevey.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In same rooms at Harvey's Hotel that you had. Found letter of instructions from Willing. Thanks for comb.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sail tomorrow. Clothes. Enjoyed summer.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace and Grandpapa arrived home. Grandpa is going to talk to Truxton about school. About house (120). Sent draft for money borrowed from you, things they want Grandma B. to bring back, and Mrs. Markoe and Molly.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Charlotte's movements abroad. Molly Coles ill, so Virginia's wedding postponed. Bar Harbor. Edmund's schooling. Political campaign - Bryan and McKinley.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delafields staying with us. Family news.

did.unittitle: I. Vernet to Misses Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: House at home. Political situation, Bryan (free silver). Horace well. Grandpapa discussing Truxtun's schooling. Aunt Katy left. Harry Mercer. Activities.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Happy in Venice. Plans for continued friendship by letter and when at home. About friends - F., Osman, Del Viso, Pascal. Mr. and Mrs. Balkinefelt ?, and Mr. Harjons. Travels.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Fete - crowds, order, enjoyment, illuminations and cortege of Czar (a night never to forget). Activities of all, Ridie, myself, Charlotte, Susie and Connie. Engage Saunders if he wishes to return to my house. Visits to and by friends here. Received letter from "Trucky" at school and glad he went back.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Same apartment you had in "89". Delayed in Paris. Last days activites before sailing.

did.unittitle: Beckie Spencer to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for Esther to dinner for Prince of Savoy, and rest of family later in evening.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning renting of house, 120 S. 22nd. St.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Nicer to meet you in Boston if you come up. Getting out school paper, playing football and studying.

scopecontent.p: Have joined a theatre group. Each girl in turn has a chafing dish supper. Next week is my turn and we are to see John Hare in "A Pair of Spectacles". Reading, visiting and going to dentist.

scopecontent.p: Delightful weather. Country dull-playing golf and seeing polo.
