scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris - had two gowns made and purchased two hats. Social events. Here (Denmark) is lovely - alone with Louise and the Count - shooting and visiting farmers. Description of place and Louise (now that she is Countess).

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Just a note in case you don't return home today.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: At a castle in Scotland.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concerning blue flannel shirt and inquiry about Grandma H.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Dusty train trip.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Trying to locate McCormick who has made arrangements for me.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On train - just crossed Missouri River.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expect to get to ranch house today.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Staying here for night - will go to ranch tomorrow.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Waiting over with Pease. Spent yesterday seeing town and people. Necessary purchases - horse, saddle, blankets, bedding and India rubber coat.

did.unittitle: Mariana to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Louise and I went to Copenhagen - stayed with Juel family. Count de Seebach, Louise's uncle-in-law, visiting. Why don't you come abroad and meet me?

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wants boots made at Steigerwalts.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Just came into town and forgot two letters - will mail them later.

did.unittitle: _________ ? to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About a horse or a dog?

did.unittitle: T. Truxtun Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant journey up here with a man I knew.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mama

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About boy engaged for $12. per month. Butler not needed this winter. Need boots.

did.unittitle: Mary Hutchinson to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcing engagement to John Osborne Summer.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wants to know more about Mr. Brown's illness and whether to congratulate Minnie on her engagement.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On way to Caen. Description of market day. Of friends abroad - Mariana and Katharine.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Out in mountain far from ranch in cabin for shooting.

did.unittitle: Newspaper clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Articles on Dreyfus Court Martial.

did.unittitle: Mariana to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Distressed over changes in Grandpa at home. Frank Shaw. Theatres, concerts and dressmaking. On Bella staying abroad for winter. Travels from Denmark through Holland.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will return with Grandpa if Wellings can't have me. All about family activities. Climbed Green Mountain and social events and friends.

did.unittitle: Richard Lears to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter of admiration of you and want to see you when in Philadelphia.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Fishing and shooting. Boots came, will do but not heavy enough.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: You are welcome to come whenever you please.

did.unittitle: Rydie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant journey home from Bar Harbor. Dined at Aunt Emily's. If Mr. and Mrs. Hare go to Hot Springs, couldn't you have house party and invite Herbert Lyman and Frank.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mother

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Riding and looking at traps. Found bear that had been that had been trapped and shot it. About blacksmith bill. Lost pony. Never had a chance with Minnie, but now she's engaged, doing best to break engagement. Wonders if he should stay all winter. Boots unsatisfactory.

did.unittitle: Minnie to Horace

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cruised up St. Lawrence. At home with Mae now.

did.unittitle: Emily to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acknowledging your "dollar". Would love to meet you in Newport for a day. Will see what turns up.

did.unittitle: Newspaper clipping

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article - Wedding of Julia Dent Grant to Prince Michael Cantacuzene.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About races and you're not going. Expect Mrs. Beale and Conny and going to New York with Conny. Other visitors and social events.

did.unittitle: Horace to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Experiences at camp - trailing trapped bear and working for neighbor ($.75 a day).

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Working for neighboring rancher. Indian visitors, exciting chase of bear but did not get him. Received note from Grandpa instructing me to come home and read law - not sure I care to. Interested in cattle business and living in West (where all men are equal).

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting invitation to visit you at Radnor.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mother

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On way to Hodge's Ranch with Dick Vaux. Am tough and dirty (take hot bath every 2 months)

did.unittitle: Horace to Mother

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note on way to Hodge's Ranch.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Molly returned from her good time at "Harford". Clergyman (Philip Salinger) at church in Bennington. Work at Bellevue Hospital, Girl's Friendly and Sunday School. Princeton. Book - "Uncle Scipio".

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of horseback ride up into mountains to camp and daily routine. Visit to miner's camp - got lost returning.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have not heard from anyone and need money. Camping and shooting.

did.unittitle: A. Goadby to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending photo of you. Studying harmony. Saw Naval Parade with Mrs. Welling. Hoping to see you next summer in Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Maria M.C. to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anxiety over Edmund. He attended football game - you must be proud of Truxton. Glad to hear Horace returned from western trip in splendid condition. Sophie and Cousin Lizzie to be in Philadelphia three days - sure Lizzie would be glad to see you.

did.unittitle: Mary Helen Cadwalader to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant and satisfying here. Anxious to talk to you about Rome after being abroad.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Opera in Philadelphia. Going South in January. Sargent's portrait of Thomas a great work of art. Social events. Thoron's visit - Edith's friendship.

did.unittitle: J. Wallace Hallowell to Judge Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill for purchase of fruits.

did.unittitle: Oliver H. Leigh to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Request for you to pen two or three hundred words to use either in or as introduction to book (History). Enclosure - Newspaper article: my letter to "Telegraph" - "An Old Englander on England's Invasion of the House of the Boers".

did.unittitle: Charles Willing Hare to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had enclosure - list of mortgages belonging to you and Mrs. Hare. Explanation of these mortgages.

did.unittitle: Emily to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Christmas card.

did.unittitle: Daisy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to country "Cake-Walk". Went to a colored concert and amusing description of colored "Arden Prima Donna".

did.unittitle: Newspaper clipping

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Article - "Scott's Scrapbook". T. Truxtun Hare made Walter Camp's All-American 4 years in succession.

did.unittitle: Elsie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for hat brush.

did.unittitle: Bertha F. Beale to Esther

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for book of Lord Nelson's life.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for your coming to New York. Accepted invitation from Katharine to dine with her Aunt. Inquiries as to family. About work and his associates and boarding house.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace's dinner. Enclosures - invitation to dine at Mr. C. Hartman Kuhn's which I refused for you and Mr. Robert Riddle's calling card.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (Private) Willing came home for weekend. About Horace's new step in life which he so much dreads, going to work in Bank. Truxtun came home this morning. Enjoyed evening at Mrs. Warrens. Mr. Tyler talked of Horace's coming into bank. Mrs. Cassatt.

did.unittitle: _______ to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation to "Juvenile Party" - Mr. and Mrs. A. Drexel Biddle. Invitation - to visit Margaret Clemens. Invitation - from Mr. and Mrs. Cassatt to meet Mr. and Mrs. Robert Cassatt.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for purse. Family news (especially about Mama and Molly). Did Katy go to Germany or is it only gossip?

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing invitation to Fortnightly Club.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing's news. About Watson's bill for Grandma and Truxtun's college fee. Going to opera and next week to Baltimore. Horace shows interest in bank. Enclosed letter from Gimbel's in reference to account.

did.unittitle: Helena R. Beale to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Aunt Emily going to give Emily a lunch - I can hardly wait. Still taking riding lessons and going to have sewing class.

did.unittitle: Mary S. Hutchinson to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Clearing up misunderstanding about letter when you were to meet John. Going to Boston to see about abiding place for next winter.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mrs. Parish has just invited us to go abroad in March. Shall we? Social events and family news. So glad you are able to do so much for Grandma and Grandpa - while you are with them, try to get them to tell of their early lives. Visited Mrs. Harry Brown - a picture of grief.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: (letter to Mother, sent to Esther) Referring to his business and influential friends. Sunday at Katharine's (Tivoli), friends, skating and ice boating. (Discusses Livingstons and guests). Plans for you and maybe Harry to come to New York.

did.unittitle: Rydie to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Apology for not seeing you before you left. Called on Mariana. Where is "that book"?

did.unittitle: Mariana to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Skating on river. Lunched with Ridie and talked of everyone. Frances Arnold visited. Going to Orpheum with Miss Woodville, supper at Mrs. Thomas Surettes and opera class.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sent your two waists. Visit to Baltimore (Colonial Dames). Home news and social events. About painting house.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosing letter for Grandma. Sent your batting dress (be careful, it gives fever). Social events (boys' costumes for "children's party").

did.unittitle: Rydie to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Frank Sears and the most enjoyable Assembly Ball. Day out at Radnor. Frank going to Palm Beach.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Making plans with Margaretta for going to Europe, and enjoying her company. Grandpa and Grandma. Think you better tell Stuart it is impossible for you to go abroad May 2.

did.unittitle: Penn Furniture Company to J.I.C. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Payment of rent for 1023 Market St.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reference to balance in Girard Bank. Gas bill. About plans for going abroad (Truxtun could go with us). Horace has German Measles (will have to call off luncheon for Emily). Had successful dinner.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have not seen Stuart, but will try to and think May 2nd a good date. Really want to go and go to a cure. Horace in bed with measles.

did.unittitle: Palm Beach Inn to J.I.C. Hare & family

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bills for Palm Beach Inn.

did.unittitle: Emily to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Weather, Horace's measles, my dinner, Mr. and Mrs. Elkins' dinner on night of blizzard, Willing's visit home and Truxtun's poetry. (This letter for Grandma Hare).

did.unittitle: Constance R. Beale to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social and family news.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Received checks, and on plans for sailing abroad.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace over measles and going back to work (splendid position). Willing was home and he is pleased with his work. Stuart Smith was here about our sailing with him. (Do you think we can go early in May?) Talk it over with Grandma and Grandpa. Enclosed letter from Stuart Farrar Smith with rooms he's engaged for passage awaiting approval.

did.unittitle: Stuart Farrar Smith to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note scolding because you are "putting off" going abroad.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to Tivoli and visited Mary Livingston first and then Katharine over Washington's birthday. Guests there. "Going out a good deal in a quiet way". Jimmy's new horse.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Biddle's party fun, but rough. Passage arranged for track team for June 20.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to Washington. Cass' surprise for me - Ridie came for a five day visit. Saw lots of our Bar Harbor friends in Washington. Praise for your going South to care for your grandparents. Visitors (Nancy Allen and Helen Waterman) and our activities.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Told Stuart to give up cabin and we'll try to go abroad at a later date. Is Margaretta going at all? Discussing plans.

did.unittitle: Katharine to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcement of engagement to Mr. Lawrence Simpson.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma's attack. Will come if you want me. More plans for sailing. Katharine Livingston engagement to Lawrence Simpson.

did.unittitle: Helena to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Chimney fire. Visited Aunt Amy at Lewistown. Family news.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reassuring to hear Grandma is better. Making arrangements for a car or compartment for Grandma to return home by the 31st. Luncheon and "howling storm". Mrs. Hopkins died leaving a week old baby. Katharine Livingston's engagement.

did.unittitle: W.W. Montgomery to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Financial business letter. (Also have six children in bed with measles.)

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concern over getting car for Grandma. Brought Laddie into town, and first night he ate up several things in parlor, so now sleeps on floor in my room. Clara's husband died and children were put in a home.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma's precarious condition. Think I better come down. Ask Mr. MacVeagh about getting a private car. Willing saw Katharine and her family are furious over her engagement. Mrs. Hopkin's death.

did.unittitle: Grandmama Beale to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Distressed at your Grandmother's set-back, but just heard better news of her. Sympathy for you in helping in this experience. News of friends, family and social activites.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Suggestion that I engage a private car, come down in it and help bring Grandma home.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Encouraged by news of Grandma. Consolation to you in this experience. Urging you get her a car to return home. On boys and weather. Laddie - perfect house pet (has not eaten anything since my patent leather slippers).

did.unittitle: Constance to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sympathy for you all in this anxiety over Grandma. Grandma Beale has bad leg and can't walk. Enclose ribbon for you.

did.unittitle: Polly Coxe to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saw Willing in New York before we sailed. People met and sights in travels.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Play that Horace is in tonight at the Cassatt's - "A Question of Honour".

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About special car for bringing Grandma home.

did.unittitle: Horace to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About Grandma's return trip home and his work. Willing has been brought back from Yonkers and goes to Patterson.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "French Play" at University of Pennsylvania. Trip to Broadwater, Virginia. Ask Grandma to send check (I need money). Willing going to Patterson to learn more about gas!

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: What you are missing - dirty streets and air full of germs. Katharine's engagement. Horace acted splendidly in "Honour Bound" at the Cassatt's. Social activites.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wishing you all were home - and awaiting word as to whether to engage car. Willing and his duty to "gas". Dinners and luncheons I gave. Miss Woodward engaged to Prince Ruspoli. MacVeagh's offer of "car" for Grandma's return.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandma improving slowly but very weak. Coming back in car with MacVeaghs.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Katharine's engagement (such a surprise). Jimmy's second horse "a secret". Social activities.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General travel news and inquiries . Going now to Rome.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About bringing Grandma home in MacVeagh's car. Dinner for the Parrishes and lunch for Emily and guests.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Either Truxtun or I will meet you in Savannah. Which would you rather have come?

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Decided to send Truxtun to meet you. Willing left this morning to live and work in Patterson. Emma, your maid, also left this morning. Truxtun's French play is tomorrow night. Will have doctor and ambulance on hand when you arrive.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Your returning home and who should meet you in Savannah.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: So unhappy over telegram saying you are not leaving till the 9th. Want you to come home with MacVeaghs and I will go down in your place.

did.unittitle: E. Lawrence to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reply to a sympathy letter on death of step-mother.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Truxtun good in "French play". Received telegram telling me not to come down, but if you need me telegraph at once.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to meet MacVeaghs and will see about car. List of Grandmama's bequests. (Palm Beach, March 9, 1900) A private letter to Horace asking advice. (Grandma's condition - nothing Mama could do, but should I send for her? Grandma could take a turn for the worse anytime.)

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to meet MacVeaghs, but they won't arrive till tomorrow. Please send check (need money).

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - car will reach Palm Beach Monday. Mr. MacVeagh's arrangements for car.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Your Mother and my Father making arrangements for car for you.

did.unittitle: Esther and J.I.C. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Inquiries about private railroad car to take Grandma home.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: More about private car. Concert for soldiers and sailors - Admiral Dewey came to it and a dinner at the Cassatt's. You and Molly Coles to be K. Livingston's bridesmaids.

did.unittitle: Robert M. Riddle to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Left two volumes of "Miss Bird's Japan" at your door - will you please see that they don't get lost?

did.unittitle: _______ to Judge Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hotel bill. Two telegrams on private car. Pharmacy bill.

did.unittitle: Esther and J.I.C.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Troubles in making arrangements for car. Will you get in at Washington?

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Got "down in dumps" because not making money and not looking forward to "year after year of slavery".

did.unittitle: T.T. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On board. (S.S. Southwark) Willing saw me off.

did.unittitle: C. Willing Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On seeing Truxtun off. Enclosing lace collar for you.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: July 6 - Very pleasant trip so far. We perform at London Athletic Club and then go to Paris. July 8 - America won 8 out of 13 events yesterday - I got 2 medals.

did.unittitle: M.C.M.V. to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for book. Pleasant voyage and mention of people on board.

did.unittitle: N. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: I love it here, but Meta and Mother don't like it. Sure you and your Mother would not like it. Social activities. If we go to York, would like you to visit there.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for summer vacationing. Willing ordered to Connecticut. Grandpapa gave me money to pay for bridesmaid dress. General home news and social activities.

did.unittitle: M.H.C. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Description of place. Too small to urge you to visit.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General family news letter.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sightseeing in Paris with Cousin E., John and Ned.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mamma

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Experiences in New York with Harry and Fox and Arthur Cosby - dinner, a row over politics (Roosevelt), music hall, Hungarian restaurant and steam bath. Saw them off at dock.

did.unittitle: M.E. Powel to Cousin Clarke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Informing you of our Mother's death.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for your coming here.

did.unittitle: Rydie to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lovely times here - men I've met and activities. Burned your letters - so don't worry.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaving soon for home. May go to North Shore after getting home. Travels, sights and people, and slight description of Isle of Wight.

did.unittitle: Ernest E. Parker to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclose cap ribbon and photos. Had jolly times at Bar Harbor.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Generator gave out and had to stop making gas - so town was in darkness. Temporary repairs have been made. Sprained my ankle.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On crutches now. Have hired boy to help me dress. Ask Grandpa to deposit $75. for me so I can pay doctor. About your taking a trip to Milford.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Family activities. Strike of coal miners (not miner's choice, but President Mitchell, United Mine Workers, intimidating men).

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Family news. Maid is trying to make an invalid of me.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Still on crutches. Brundrett told me to come home, but want to stay to finish work. About your coming up.

did.unittitle: Montgomery Nurseries to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bills for planting, stone, bulbs, etc.

did.unittitle: John Cadwalader to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Business letter on Sioux City bonds. Have been following Truxtun in football games - has very fine qualities.

did.unittitle: Mr. & Mrs. Walter Horstmann to Mr. T. Truxton Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for December 11 from 5 until 7.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coming to Philadelphia, want you to lunch with me. Working for the first time in my life.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Could not accept Cameron Forbes invitation for Thanksgiving dinner - business here. Visited school - saw Ollie (talked to his master and he's irresponsible, wild and hard to manage).

did.unittitle: Mrs. Joseph Leidy, Jr., Miss Kathryn M. Leidy to Mr. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation - at home December 13 from 5 until 7. Thursdays in January after 4.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visiting Ollie at school, but he was in trouble again (always in trouble - has not got good sense). Mapping out where new gas lamps are to go. Truxtun's football.

did.unittitle: Mrs. Alexander W. Biddle to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Notice - will be unable to receive December 6 - owing to a death in family.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Where were you? (Lunch I invited you to). Will visit you in January and would love to see "Tosca" and "Cyrano". Do not care about opera.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Estherine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note with money and cards. Telegram wishing "Merry Christmas".

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for card case. Plans for when I come January 2

did.unittitle: Andrew to Mr. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: News from Radnor - brought mare down from Mr. Mather's, Chance exercised, man wants to buy Puck, and man here about sewing machines.

did.unittitle: M.C.M.V. to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Will dine with Clara and Stuart the 5th. Do join us at opera.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On social events and work. Expect to go again to Concord and will again see Ollie.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Spent several glorious days on houseboat on New River. Apologies for not writing and thanking you for getting stockings, corset, covers and books.

did.unittitle: Program of Browning Society

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "Author's Night". Poem by Truxtun Hare, "Broadwater, Virginia."

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Surrounded by invalids to take the cure.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanks for book of sonnets. Coming to Philadelphia - will you go shopping with me?

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Baron has gone to German East Africa - sending his last cards. Social events.

did.unittitle: George Allen to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill for ribbons, shields, buttons, etc.

did.unittitle: Royal Insurance Company of Liverpool

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Insurance policy for Esther Hare.

did.unittitle: John G. Johnson to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Impossible to take Judge Hare's grandson into office.

did.unittitle: Katie to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sympathy for you taking care of two old, dying people. Feel there was trickery over children's money - Ollie will not be able to return to St. Paul's. Madie going to boarding school after we return from Switzerland. Expect to be presented to Court. Enclosed picture of Viola Beale Homer.

did.unittitle: Grace Parrish Emerson to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for silver basket (wedding gift) and handkerchief case.

scopecontent.p: Sympathy on hearing of Judge Hare's illness and impending death.

did.unittitle: J.R. McLean to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram "Electricity on stomach - 40 drops Iodide Potash every 3 hours. Will be in Philadelphia tomorrow".

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Written on the Atlantic. Voyage and travel plans.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reply to note of sympathy on death of George's only son, Francis.

did.unittitle: M.C. Mitchell to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reached New York after trip to Japan to find brother very ill.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Weather, voyage and passengers. Father weak. Sending pink waist to you to copy.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wonder why you didn't come to lunch yesterday. Leaving for Nova Scotia.

did.unittitle: Anna Scott Hart to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you note for flowers.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mrs. Holsmann has gotten me a room at York. Comments on home news.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Things going smoothly at Harford. Aunt Connie came. Going with Van Reusselaer's to see Astor Cup races at Newport. Aunt C. going to Mrs. Wellings - Newport too expensive.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Please send $25. at once - I am broke. Delightful here.

did.unittitle: Constance to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for sending my glasses, wish you would write.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lunched with Cadwaladers - did not know anything of tragedy (having to identify body and law suit). General family news. About your going to Nancy - think Truxtun should go all the way with you.

did.unittitle: Edward Watson to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Accepting invitation to Radnor. Heat in Washington terrific. (Why are cities built where climate is so bad?)

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Boating and sports. Plans on meeting you and going to Canada.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sailing for home end of month. All about friends, Paris, "peaches melba", Homburg, Schwalbach, and books.

did.unittitle: K. to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visitors and family.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Met Esther in Boston and traveled with her to Quebec and she left with Miss Bickely for Murray Bay. Visited Sims, then went to Ste. Flore, Mr. Nelson met me and took me to his house (very wild, only three houses on lake). Fishing and going on a three week's trip north in the wilds.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad to hear of your arrival at Hutchinsons. Grandpa taking drive now. Launching of the "Truxtun". Dinner with Willing and Horace. Furs.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Things going well at home. If you find a native Canadian servant, do bring her. Home news.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have redeemed your ticket and enclose check for $25. Grandpapa and Grandmama improved. Dined with Horace and Mama at Merion Club.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sailing, bathing, etc. Family news.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About pony, your fur coat, and Horace talking about his fur coat, since he bought another Polo pony. Mrs. Smith (nurse) left - Grandpa the hardest case she has ever had. Garden flowers. Would like to live here all year, if we could lead our own lives.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Delightful here. Fishing, canoeing and walking. Starting north for three weeks's trip.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enjoyed Narragansett. Account of activities and people there. Maimy wants C. to go back to Bulgaria with her - Connie considering it. Ollie (with McLeans) - whether or not he's going back to St. Paul's School. Social activities here. Black cook - creator of such tempting dishes and also an artist.

did.unittitle: Mariana to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travels - Wales, London and Swiss village (Champery). Going to Paris. Friends and social events. Ethel going to stay and study music. I may visit a while in England.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mrs. Smith and Miss Pierce (nurse) are gone, but have another. Do not lose this chance of getting furs (maybe Canadian Sables) for Mamma (enclosing my check for $150.)

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mrs. Smith and Miss Pierce have gone. On getting furs, coming home, family, etc.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Start tomorrow on hunting trip. Plans for same.

did.unittitle: Grace Parrish Emerson to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travels abroad. (Thank you for talking over this journey with us.) Enclosed "edelweiss".

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cannot meet you - am needed here. Home news.

did.unittitle: N. to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social events after you left Murray Bay.

did.unittitle: M. (Maimy?) to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Would love to see you at Philadelphia station tomorrow.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant visit with Cousin Attie. Willing active with social events. See that Frank has a proper livery to drive in (unless Horace is going to get another man). Have George wash Laddie and oil shutter bolts.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Awakened during night by news boys crying "McKinley's death". Servant problems. Willing's and my social activities. This place so up-to-date (every other vehicle is an automobile, and how girls drive about alone or with a groom).

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Got back from glorious trip, but no luck hunting or fishing. Did shoot a porcupine and bringing skin home. Plans for coming home and mentions President's death.

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Ethel and Mariana to stay in Paris. Ethel to study music and Mariana will return in November. We sail September 28th (Isabel and I).

did.unittitle: Emily to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Appreciation for book (Keats). Hope to have a better way of living next winter and be able to see you often then.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wellings gave me such a welcome. Cass going to Molly Baltz' for a week. Family news, activities and old friends at Newport.

did.unittitle: WIlliam G. Smith to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Acceptance of invitation to dine.

did.unittitle: Mariana to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travels - now with Grace and Haven (brother-in-law) in Paris. Going to England. Family news. About your "secret" (out of town all winter). Studying French.

did.unittitle: Ethel Phelps to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Announcement of engagement to Mr. William North Deane.

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Note accompanying slippers. Merry Christmas wishes. Acceptance of invitation to family party.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friendly letter enclosing newspaper article on bookbinding.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for flowers on 78th birthday.

Stuart Farrar Smith to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.p: Thank you for flowers (during illness - typhoid).

scopecontent.p: Disappointment, you did not go with us?

did.unittitle: Jack Poke to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Must remain here a couple of more months before going abroad.

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry I didn't see you. Thank you for crabs.

did.unittitle: ________ Bayard to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wants you to visit.

did.unittitle: Cass to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Visit to Molly (expecting baby). Had gout. News of family.

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sights, scenery, etc. Passage over. Heading for London and Coronation.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: People here, puppy, "Godfrey's Cove", etc.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Questions on entries in check book. Hopes to get horse. Comments on your activities.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Admiration for you in past few weeks with me, and be careful of what you say. And a note from Mariana - "you are nicest friend in the world".

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Country dull - like a merry-go-round without the music and brass ring.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Coronation of King Edward tomorrow. Westminster Abbey has been closed all summer, but Ned got letter from Secretary of State, and Arch Deacon is going to take us through.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Anquish over Katy's burns. Praise for her husband, Mr. Homer, who saved her life and Madie's last summer. Unsettled plans about going to her. Mrs. Hare was very bad, but has rallied somewhat. Changeable weather. Ned and Maria and coronation. Social events (luncheons, dinners, etc.) Horace's activities.

did.unittitle: Walter Lowrie to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending photos and referring to bad days when you were here.

did.unittitle: E.F.B. to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travelling running smoothly and on way to London. (This letter maybe dated wrong.) Postcard - Martigny.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Katy's burns healing. Still do not know whether to go to her and does not want Connie to go. Ned and Maria due home. Reading "The Virginian" (Mr. Hare vetoed it when we were reading aloud, so Connie, Horace and I reading it when we can get hold of it.) Horace won mug at Devon. Ned and Maria home. Not going to Katy now but maybe later. Enthusiasm over Ned's seeing Westminster Abbey and invitation to view the coronation procession. Rydie's engagement to be announced.

did.unittitle: May Ritelir ? to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Camping. Father and Mother coming.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Plans for September if you come home and of friends.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cannot visit you there. Wonderful weather, driving, fitting for habit, and friends.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: In reference to your drawing money on Grandpa's account. Grandpa and Grandma away and having Harford cleaned. Think I have a horse for Mamma.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Deposit to your account. Grandma's illness at Atlantic City.

did.unittitle: Jennie to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On Mrs. Hare's serious illness in Atlantic City. Telegram from Horace advising - slightly better, do not come. Note from E.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: So many friends mentioned and social events. Truxtun Beale's unfortunate affair. Drives (mine and Connie's). Plans for journey to Wellings. Just heard of Mrs. Hare's serious illness and that you have gone to Atlantic City.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On plans after receiving news of Mrs. Hare's death.

scopecontent.p: Very dull and dreary here - Horace good natured about it. About Grandma's coming. General news of friends, events, etc.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Truxton and I going to Kineo, Maine. and then will join you. Esther went with MacVeagh's yesterday. Vic chloriformed this morning - suffering so. Aunt Katy at Inn at Radnor and Madie at Harford.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: So sorry to leave you - miss you.

did.unittitle: T. Truxtun Hare to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hoping to meet Willing and Horace for trip into woods. Card from C.W.H. from Kineo - Horace arrived and all moves well.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant journey. Met Willing and on our way to Kineo.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Get Horace's money, deposit to my account and I will advance it to Horace. All goes well.

did.unittitle: M. to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for gifts. On sea voyage. Saw new comet (Boselli's)

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace arrived and everything okay.

did.unittitle: May Mott to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.p: Drive over some day and lunch with me.

scopecontent.p: Account of Katy (still miserable) and her family. Plans of Esther's mine and Connie's for coming to Maine. Social engagements. Mr. Hare's portrait.

scopecontent.p: Want you to come here and stay till boys come.

scopecontent.p: Comments on "Vic's" death. Travel and activities. Clothes prices high.

scopecontent.p: Chatty, lonely, friendly letter.

scopecontent.p: Stay longer if you want to. Would like Elsie to come. Family activities. Ollie came home from Zermatt having climbed Matterhorn twice. Enclosed letter from Martha Dana - declining invitation to visit.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had delightful hunting trip in Canada (describes it).

scopecontent.p: Had to leave Bar Harbor because house closed. Visiting Mrs. Welling. Selected silver tea kettle for Rydie's wedding gift. Inquiring about family plans for Rydie's wedding. Madie on way home.

scopecontent.p: Drove up to Harford and saw all the family. My family all to be away and Leonard and I will be alone. Truxtun passed his examination but think he is not going to Philippines.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visited Harford. Congratulated Truckie on being a full fledged lawyer. Rejoice he has given up Philippines and hopes he will do same with the Smith girl. On Mr. Hare and growing old. Katy better. Hope and I going to Detroit.

did.unittitle: London and Paris

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Receipted bills.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of Austrian linens ordered. (Arrived Jan. 1906)

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Willing

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Definitely decided not to go to East. I'm going to Canada with Bishop and then Horace and I are going to Wyoming if we get guides and if not, then we're going to Canada. Aunt Katie much improved.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have given up all idea of going away and will stay in Mr. Bell's office. Closed offer to write boy story for Penn Publishing Co. and details of same. Auto accident of Mr. & Mrs. Valentine, Frances Roberts and Ben Chew. Going to Canada, then to Wyoming with Horace and then office work.

did.unittitle: Peal & Co. to H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bill

did.unittitle: Matilda Markoe to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Taking cure. Do come.

did.unittitle: Madie (niece) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mama getting better.

did.unittitle: J.I. Clark Hare, Aunt Constance to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on your hearing Mr. Balfour the Premier, and what do you think of him. Luncheons, teas, friends and home and family news. Oliver Perry Smith's address in Germany.

did.unittitle: M.M. to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Advice on where to get clothes. Travels, friends, sights, etc.

did.unittitle: Emily to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Invitation for you to come to lunch and Willing can go to races with John, and how about going to Venice week after next. Enclosed letter from Maimy - would be enchanted to have a visit from Emily and Esther Hare.

did.unittitle: Sydney to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for post card. Can swim and caught two turtles.

did.unittitle: Alice B. Rush to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Great Aunt Cassie died. Daisy Rush to marry Spencer Murray. Friendly chat. Newspaper article on auto crash - Mr. & Mrs. J.R. Valentine.

did.unittitle: N. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Travel news, sights, etc.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Have a splendid cabin and boat looks clean.

did.unittitle: Maria M. Coxe to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memories of Devonshire (1869). Taking care of Polly's baby. Angelina, my cousin, now with me. Sending you a brush and comb case. Family news.

did.unittitle: Louis H. Rush to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for parcel and hope to see you in Paris when you return.

did.unittitle: Maria to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Katie much better. All your family at home seem okay. Just returned from Detroit, going to Ogden's camp, Rydie and family coming here. Building addition on house and stable.

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A. Beale) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on your travels. Mr. Hare seems more infirm but still wants to go to Atlantic City. Horace was playing trick on me - sending me scenes of Philadelphia on postcards, saying they were from Europe, but I found him out. Katie's improvement marvelous. Marie's sewing. Home news on boys, house, etc. Friends and accidents. Excited over peace conference - especially knowing two of the envoys. On Truxtun's giving up Philippines. Horace good manager.

did.unittitle: M.H.C. to Mrs. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Molly to Miss E.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social activities, friends and Browning readings.

did.unittitle: Willing to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had a very pleasant summer traveling with you and Mamma.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Do not come home by this line - most uncomfortable. Passengers, jewelry and "Code".

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Commenting on your activities. Nannie. Truxtun off to camp with Bishop Nelson. Viola's visit. Katy much improved. Other visitors. Mr. Hare still wants to go to Atlantic City. Mrs. Holsmen's death. Willing telephoned from New York he just arrived. News of family and friends.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Want you to come home. Clothes. Evelyn Willing's death. Your Irish Terrier pup.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Humorous letter of home news.

did.unittitle: Mary Helen Cadwalader to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Relatives and friends. Travel and sights.

did.unittitle: Constance to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Expecting Willing today. Madie's tea party. Home news.

did.unittitle: L. Spurgeon to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mr. Hare's trunks packed for Atlantic City, but hope he'll decide not to go. Mr. Willing arrived home.

did.unittitle: Nancy to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Recommends going to Oberammergan. Kate left for Ireland. Travels. Wish we were sailing earlier - Mother restless.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandpapa well (feeble), but gave up idea of going to Atlantic City. Things running okay about house. Saw Margaretta and Clara Farrar Smith. Family news and activities. Advice on answering inspectors when arriving.

did.unittitle: Katharine to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Disappointed you are not returning to England, but you must have had an interesting time at Marienbad with the King there. Comments on "the peace".

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A.B.) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing's arrival home and his purchases. Willing went to see Katy. Horace left for Narragansett (usher at Hitchcock wedding). Envy you seeing the King so much. News of friends, visitors and family.

did.unittitle: Anne M. Hindkoper to Emily (McClean ?)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 8 September-Description of visit to City Hospital (Mary's own children's ward for blind in memory of your Mother). The opening of a Catholic home for Orphans. 14 September-Description of service for the Russian Peace. (Prince Ferdinand there.) Mary and I at the service and Prince presented to me. Breakfast after ceremony.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Your Irish Terrier pup, and things at your house seem well.

did.unittitle: Paris

scopecontent.p: Alfred de Musset (1843)

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cable - "No truth in report contracted everywhere".

did.unittitle: Meta H. Hutchinson to Mrs. Horace Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Had a most wonderful crossing - Paris Herald untrue about that, but Cadwalader's had terrific crossing. Family. (Something about cable and worry).

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - "Your family all well much love good voyage back"

did.unittitle: Agnes Sampson to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thank you for roses (death of father).

did.unittitle: Horace to Hon. J.I. Clark Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memories of you on trips we had and wish we had more together. Interesting journey, made so by men flocking to small town, Cobalt, where silver has been found.

did.unittitle: Truxtun to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Start on our two week trip tomorrow.

did.unittitle: George Hall Jr. to Mr. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account with Hon. J.I.C. Hare (properties Iseminger and Clarion Sts.) (Plumbing bill, 75 cents)

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Just returned from wilderness after getting moose. Horace to stay for another week.

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A.B.) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasant journey to Wellings. Drives, visits, teas and friends. Lady Vernon Harcourt. Blow on forehead when pitched against carriage door. Mr. Hare's helpless condition and state of nerves. Mystery of death of Mr. Clyde. Saw that Bakhmeteff being made minister to Japan and account of Maimy's life. Katy. William Goddard. Water rent bill. About papering hall.

did.unittitle: George Hall Jr. to Mr. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Account with Hon. J.I.C. Hare - including bills paid. (Clarion and Iseminger St. properties)

did.unittitle: Mother (M.A.B.) to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Visit to Mrs. Russell's in Providence (among her pictures she has a large photograph of Mr. Horace Binney). About papering hall. Water rent tax bill. Have you seen my black lace Spanish scarf? (May be at Lena Spencer's). On family, friends, Welling's visitors and Virginia Gammell's engagement. Puppy bites.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: All about the pepering.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Miss you. Going to Army-Navy game with Secretary of War.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Day at Princeton - Army-Navy game. Telephone conversation with Alice Roosevelt. Social activities - dinners, teas, etc. Going to Philadelphia, will you meet me? Stuart now full Naval Constructor.

scopecontent.p: Bill for linens.

scopecontent.p: Will you let me know how much money I have in bank and pay Acorn Club bill? Stuart on way home. Social engagements. It upsets me that you have a lack of will for a "grown up life".

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: About correspondence. Charlie's journey to Canada and around New York (went to "Airation Meet" at which parachutist was killed). Connie's visit to Drifton. Melba is here at Inn - singing into some Grafaphone "Victor" for which she gets $1000. Daisy and Viola Beale at Dog Show. "Guir House" by my son (Charles) Visit to Ned's to see Charlie. Visitors - Jennie Cassatt and Maria.

did.unittitle: Marian Mott to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Dinner with Willing and Horace. Horace's visit on Sunday - took C. as far as "Old Radnor Church". Sunday before we went to Ardmore Church. News of friends, postcards, Truxtun and family and social engagements.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Waiting in bathing suit for H. Bathing, sailing, tea, etc. While sailing on "Venture", the mast broke off - had to be taken home and send motor boat for boat. H. has given up moose shooting and Ben agreeable guest.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Finger well again. Children. Rarely see Horace. Had Willing's car to go to dinner of Andrew Gray's, also went to dinners at Snowden's and Pepper's.

scopecontent.p: Comments on your travels, and your Great Grandmother Hare's experience in Madeira. Visitors and news of friends and family. Rarely see Horace. Motor drives. Dr. Musser's death.

did.unittitle: Thomas R. Elcock, Jr. to Mr. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Business news, (have been representing you, and on advertising). Changes in high offices of company Theodore Roosevelt carried Pennsylvania in primaries. Politics.

did.unittitle: T.T.H. to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Roosevelt swept primaries of Pennsylvania. Auto accident which killed Hoffman and Ryerson - Ryerson's parents returned on disastrous Titanic. Tom Smith escaped from Junior Republic.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Surrounded by flowers (Easter gifts). Family activities. Visits by family and friends. Connie feeling miserable. Comments on your travels. Connie's social engagements. Truxtun visited. Katharine in mourning for uncle. Dr. Musser's death. Mrs. McKane's death. Auto accident killing Lewis Hoffman and Arthur Ryerson. Visit from Horace. Thank you for scarf. Awful news of Titanic (Mr. Ryerson missing).

scopecontent.p: Titanic (Mr. John Thayer missing). Newspaper article "Mrs. Thayer's Story of Wreck".

scopecontent.p: Titanic tragedy. Children. Have been to Hot Springs for week. Have decided to sublet our cottage at Winter Harbor. Social news - Ben Chew's marriage to Ann Thomson and Tom Ridgeway's engagement to Miss Wayne. Those having babies.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: On your travels. Visitors - Dr. Ingham and Mr. Meigs. Horace, weather, Connie, social events, advising you to go to Ireland and see "Power's court" (ancestry established), George Vanderbilt's missing the Titanic, Mrs. Frank Bond's death and husband's "drinking". Life of Uncle Edward is out in book form but not for sale yet.

scopecontent.p: Saw Canadian Highlanders drill. Be nice to F. (check enclosed - never cashed)

scopecontent.p: In war zone. Description of Montreal (military air). Comments on the war. Going fishing.

scopecontent.p: Ill and in bed for six weeks - treatment for gout.

scopecontent.p: Horace and I fishing for salmon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Question about vegetable soup for diet. Doubtless he will write for "Life" for a prize. Would like to read the story you wrote.

did.unittitle: Horace to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.p: Explanation of a Bogen. Fishing, walking and swimming. Thanks for books. Sent you a salmon.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad you enjoyed the fish. When we leave Horace will come right home and I will go to Newport.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: H. and I have caught 15 salmon in three days. Sending you four - one for Mr. MacVeagh.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending salmon. H. and I continue to have splendid sport.

did.unittitle: Charles to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Enclosed article on "the estimation of German civilization" from the pen of Emile Verhaeren.

did.unittitle: Charles Beale to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Great admirer of Colonel Watterson, and want you to read his article enclosed "Touching Herman Ridder".

did.unittitle: Edward F. Beale to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Mother in such good spirits and apparent good health.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandmama active - motoring. I'm playing golf. Horace going to camp. (Postcards from H. Brengle).

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Grandmama enjoying herself. Truxton and Catharine dined with us. Horace and I going to Atlantic City. Kim ill - disappeared - but returned (dog). Intense heat. About your looking for small cottage there to rent.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friendly telegrams.

did.unittitle: C.W. Hare to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Car repaired. Intense heat. Chair and table arrived from Newport. About Horace, Grandmama, Uncle Ned and our western trip.

did.unittitle: Mother to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace's visit. Want to hear about war speeches. Connie at Narragansett (her social activities). My social engagements.

did.unittitle: Newspaper - New York Herald

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: War news - headlines "German Armie Capture Warsaw and Draw Net Tighter About Retreating Russians; France Sure of Victory, says Mr. Poincare".

did.unittitle: Frances Devereux to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hoping to see you at Bar Harbor after visit to Saratoga.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace drilling at Armory and inoculated against typhoid. Grandmama well - Aunt Connie expected home. Information on western trip with Esther and copy of itinerary.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Intense heat. Hoarce and I took Truxtun's boy to Atlantic City - had motor trouble. "The boy" gave Horace and I a strenuous day. Home news.

did.unittitle: Horace to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Willing and I took "the boy" to Atlantic City (took us back 20 years). Leaving tonight for Plattsburg, (idea is to bring home to the Administration the sentiment toward Bryanism and a policy of inefficiency).

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Horace has gone to camp and prefers cavalry. Esther must let me know about western trip. Weather. Dinner at Uncle Ned's. Grandmama motoring and excited about article in magazine on Lady Blessington. Judge Hoffman's visit.

did.unittitle: Newspaper - New York Herald

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: War news.

did.unittitle: The Garden Club to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: A Memoriam for Mrs. C. Stuart Patterson.

did.unittitle: Wayne MacVeagh to Mrs. Horace Binney Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pleasure your note about my article on war gave me. (The note that was written to him)

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: General news of activities and friends.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Concert - Kreisler. Social activities.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sending you postal from Douglas. H. arrived okay and in charge of platoon of cavalry. Letter from Willing - difficult to find anyone to chaperone Esther on western trip. Home and family news. Horace in charge of platoon of cavalry.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to Newport to see Maimy and went to tennis semi-finals with her (saw friends there). About rooms in Newport. Fleet here - go out every Monday and return end of week.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Social engagements. Heard whole diplomatic staff ordered to Washington. Very solemn church service.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Read Roosevelt's speech of the camp at Plattsburg - sounds a little too warlike. Had tea with Evelyn McLean.

did.unittitle: American Relief Clearing House to E.B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Received cases and forwarding to L'Independance la Croix Rouge, Havre.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Hare

scopecontent.p: About painting at home. Mrs. Pepper and Mrs. Scott went to Plattsburg and saw Horace. Social activities.

did.unittitle: Maria to Miss Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sorry I cannot remain and go to Exposition with you.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leaving tomorrow and coming straight home (not feeling well). Truxtun and K. visited me.

did.unittitle: C. Wright to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friendly letter.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - reply after hearing from you.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Speeding away from you - sore throat almost gone.

did.unittitle: C.W.H. to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Motored along Lake. E. better. Names of people for Horace to see.

did.unittitle: Stuart Farrar Smith to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.p: Telegram - hope to meet you in Vancouver. Hope you can visit here.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - see if you can spend Friday here.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.p: Telegram - talked with Horace - all well at home.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Heading for Rockies and Lake Louise. Very comfortable travelling. Landscape - no trees, wheat fields and hay fields. Willing stopped in St. Paul to see a Miss Griggs - "like a sailor - a girl in every town".

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Cooler weather. Lunched at Chew's. Tonight Mamma, C. and Cass came to supper. Servant problem working out.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lovely here - hate to leave. Going to Vancouver - expect to meet Stuart there.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Comments on our being at peace and feeding the world and the "Europeans raising Hell." Ollie - he and H. had a set-to on the Germans again. Hope to be married and I've rented them my house (120) for one month. Hoping something worthwhile turns up for Horace instead of his going to help the Allies (which he's thinking of).

did.unittitle: Maria Beale to C. Willing Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Found it impossible to put off departure so as to be there when you came.

scopecontent.p: Telegram - Stuart met us at Vancouver.

scopecontent.p: Been with Stuart.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: H. wants to go away somewhere, so may take a trip. Saw Margaretta. Social engagements and home news.

did.unittitle: Mother to C.W. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: News of home and friends and social engagements. Hope's wedding plans. Horace still weighing things in his mind as to what "road to take". Talked with Mrs. Meigs who just returned from San Francisco (says nothing so fine as the fair - so really enjoy it).

scopecontent.p: Telegram - all well.

scopecontent.p: Batch of telegrams - just sort of general - advising all well, inquiries, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Telegram - all well.

did.unittitle: Willing to Mrs. H.B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friends entertaining us - a very full and enjoyable week. Fair - far ahead of anything I have ever seen. Will tell Horace all about ranching when I return - think less all the time of his going to France with the ambulance. Leaving for Santa Barbara. E's tooth has been troublesome but is better.

did.unittitle: Esther to Mrs. Horace B. Hare

scopecontent.p: Fair - a marvel. Had delightful day at San Rafael with Mr. and Mrs. Babcock. Dinner with Mrs. Lansdale.

scopecontent.p: Telegram - thinking of you and good times I'm missing.

scopecontent.p: Raising money for the Cause. Do want copies of "The Spur". Sympathize with you in letting Horace go to the war.

did.unittitle: Katharine Hare to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.p: We all thank you for Pattie's cutouts and our candies.

scopecontent.p: Thank you for candy.

scopecontent.p: Child's letter.

did.unittitle: Margaretta to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Owe you so much (not merely money), sending pitiful check.

did.unittitle: American Fund for French Wounded to Miss Esther Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Thanking you for two cases of supplies.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Going to remain here with Willing and rest. Can't think of H. going without tears coming to my eyes. Let me know what's the matter with Conny. Sent your trunk. War news very encouraging.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Went to York bathing beach - met Alice Thayer and her sister. Social engagements. W. had good war talk with Mr. Ellis. Sorry to hear about Conny - what is it she has? Plans for coming home with Willing.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Surprised you have not received your trunk yet. Thank heavens it is clear and Willing can go fishing!

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Glad Horace is able to get home - makes him seem less far away. Disgusted your trunk hasn't arrived. Leaving here tomorrow - go to Newport and then I will come by train and Willing will motor. About Willing's valet (may be better to get a female!) Conny speaks of herself as an invalid.

did.unittitle: Mother to Miss Esther B. Hare

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Motor trip here. Soldiers and sailors parade the streets of Newport. Saw Daisy Wright, lunched with Maimy and going to have dinner with her tonight.

did.unittitle: Ouvroir De Mme. Wharton to Miss Hare

scopecontent.p: Bill for lingerie.

did.unittitle: Ouvroir De Mme. Wharton to Miss Hare
